With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income and continue supporting his family.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to have his motorcycle taxi serviced and repaired so that he can provide a good service

loans.name: Henry Emanuel

texts.es:
Henry tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Henry desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos, ovejas  y cabras), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y para sanidad de sus animales, con la finalidad de que sus animales estén sanos y aptos para el consumo de las personas, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Henry es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más para brindarle más comodidades a su familia en casa.
texts.en:
Henry is 29 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home which does not receive basic services.  His home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Henry has been raising and selling animals (pigs, sheep and goats) for five years.  His pens are located behind his home and he feeds his animals nutritionally-balanced feed and natural fodder.  Once they have reached an optimal level of growth, he is able to sell them in the different markets in his area and make very good profits with which he covers his household expenses.

Henry has requested a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed and to keep his animals healthy.  His goal is for his animals to be healthy and suitable for human consumption.  He will use the income that he makes to repay his loan and improve his standard of living.  Henry is a hard-working and dedicated person.  The only thing he wants is for his business to continue to grow so that he can provide his family with more conveniences at home.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed and to keep his animals healthy

loans.name: Emerson Remberto

texts.es: El sr. Emerson es una persona responsable que se dedica al servicio  de ayudante Mecánico de Motocicletas, tiene experiencia en este rubro hace un año atrás, y según referencias que obtuvimos es una persona responsable que trabaja todos los días, tiene 21 años y como es joven él no cuenta con un capital propio por lo cual vino  y nos solicitó un crédito para mejorar el servicio al que se dedica, porque invertira en herramientas
texts.en: Emerson is a responsible person who works as an assistant motorcycle mechanic.  He has one year's experience in this line of work and, according to references that we obtained, he is a responsible person who works every day.  He is 21 years old and, as he is young, he doesn't have his own capital which is why he came and asked us for a loan, so that he can improve the service that he provides.  He will invest in buying tools.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing motorcycles

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 43 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, no cuentan con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Morropón, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de Piura.

Jorge brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior, la actividad que realiza lo hace durante todo el día hasta las 6 de la tarde, a pesar de la competencia trata de obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar su necesidades familiares.

Desea solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para usarlo en el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos accesorios para su mototaxi. Necesita mantener sus moto en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 43 years old.  He lives with his family in their own home, where they don't have electricity or running water.  They live in the district of Morropón, which is an agricultural and livestock region in the department of Piura.

Jorge provides passenger transportation with his mototaxi.  This is a vehicle which has a motorbike and a cabin for passengers.  He does this work every day until 6 p.m.  In spite of the competition, he tries to earn the income necessary to cover his family's expenses.

He wants to request a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will use to do maintenance and replace several accessory parts on his mototaxi.  He needs to keep his mototaxi in good condition, to be able to provide his customers with good service.

With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income and continue moving his family forward in life.

loans.use: to do maintenance and replace some accessory parts on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
La señora Gloria nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento D. Cusco, Actualmenrte, ella vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació. (En la fotografía la señora Gloria está levantando la mano). 

La señora Gloria es padre y madre para sus dos hijos (mateo D. 8 años y Carmen 5 años), ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante sus hijos, ella es profesora pero no ejerce su profesión por que la paga no es muy buena pero trabaja en una empresa privada D. transportes D. encomiendas. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio.   

La señora Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Emprendemos el Futuro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal como por ejemplo para la educación D. sus hijos, para alimentación y otras necesidades del hogar. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Emprendemos el Futuro” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. útiles escolares, venta D. ropa, venta D. comestibles y los demás trabajan como asistente administrativo, confección D. ropa y enseñando educación.  

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. (Las socias que aparece en la parte inferior D. la fotografía llegaron tarD. a la reunión.)
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Cusco, Cusco Department.  She currently lives in the city of her birth.  (In the photo, Gloria is raising her hand).  Gloria is both mother and father for her two children (Mateo, 8 and Carmen, 5).  She’s a hardworking mother who supports her children.  She’s a teacher but does not work in her profession because salaries are too low.  She works in a private package delivery firm.  She’s been in this business for two years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business.  Gloria is a member of the “Emprendemos el Futuro” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan for personal use; for example, for her children’s education, for food and for other household needs.

The “Emprendemos el Futuro” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco.  Its members are hardworking, enterprising people who are always looking for ways to get ahead and through their own efforts proviD. a better future for their children.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco and the economic activities of the other members are for example: sale of school supplies, clothing sales, food sales.  Others are employed as administrative assistants, seamstresses and teachers.

Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

(The members who appear at the bottom of the photo arrived late to the meeting).

loans.use: to pay for her children's schooling and to buy food and for other household needs.

loans.name: Ramona Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ramona , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen un hija a su cargo actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Ramona desde hace varios años labora en una empresa privada , la mayor afectación  que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos economicos  para poder realizar de una sola vez la mejora a su humilde vivienda ;  ya que es de muy escasos recursos , ella necesita comprar zinc ya que en tiempos de lluvia se inunda la vivienda  y algunos materiales de construcción como bloque , cemento , arena , entre otros para cambiar de tablas a concreto , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que sin ellos no fuese posible realizar el sueño de ver  su casita convertida en un techo digno .
texts.en:
Ramona lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  Her husband helps her with household expenses; they have a daughter in their care.  Her plan for the family is to improve their quality of life.  Ramona has worked for a private firm for several years.  

The greatest problem she currently faces is not having economic resources to improve her humble dwelling all at once because her resources are so limited.  She needs to buy metal sheeting because during the rainy season her house floods and some other building materials like concrete block, cement and sand, among other, to change from wood panels to concrete.  

She is grateful for the support Afodenic, though Kiva funds, provides because without that support it would be impossible for her to make her dream of turning her little house into a proper home come true.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es: El señor Cosme un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa e hijos , ya todos independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don     Cosme  desde hace varios se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo ya que estas carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una mejor mantención de la misma , los planes futuro hacia la plantación es poder diversificar el cultivos .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que son muchos los agricultores que nos apoyamos con el financiamiento para sacar una buena cosecha y calidad del producto .
texts.en: Cosme is a small farmer in Ticuantepe.  He lives with his wife and children who are all independent now.  His plan for his family is to improve their living condition.  Cosme has been a pineapple farmer for several years now.  His greatest challenge at present is the pests that invade his crops because he lacks fertilizer and other farm supplies to better care for his crops.  His plan for the future is to be able to diversify his crops.  He is grateful for the support from Afodenic through Kiva funds because there are a lot of farmers who get support from the loans in order to attain good harvests and good quality products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Tatiana Yiselth

texts.es: La joven Tatiana, es una pequeña agricultora de la zona Ticuantepe con muchas ganas de superarse ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su abuelo para ver el cultivo mientras estudia y termina su carrera , Tatiana desde hace tres años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuanta con el recurso económico para darle mantenimiento al cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para que se desarrolle la fruta y no invadan las plagas ;  que si esto llegara a suceder seria una pérdida total . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para poder salir adelante con la producción de piña .
texts.en:
The young woman Tatiana has a small farm in the Ticuantepe region, and has a lot of eagerness to succeed.  She has the support of her grandfather who keeps an eye on the crops while she is studying and completing her degree.

Tatiana has been working for three years growing pineapples.  Her biggest challenge is that she doesn't have the financial resources to maintain her crops.  She lacks the fertilizers and supplies necessary to grow her fruit and avoid infestations; if this were to happen, it would be a total loss.

She is grateful for the confidence that Afodenic is showing to her through Kiva, so that she can move forward with her pineapple production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: El señor  Santos en un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, habita junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Santos desde hace años se dedica al cultivo de piña y pitahaya la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos ; ya que estos son su fuente de ingresos para su familia , los planes futuros es poder establecer diversos cultivos de cítricos para obtener ingresos extras . Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para que muchos agricultores como él puedan realizar a tiempo la inducción al cultivo para mejora la calidad y sobre todo su sabor natural.
texts.en: Santos is a humble farmer from Ticuantepe.  He lives with his wife and children.  His plan for his family is to provide them with better living conditions.  Santos has been growing pineapple and dragon fruit for several years.  The greatest challenge he faces is not having enough economic resources to provide better care for his crops since they are his family’s source of income.  Plans for the future are to be able to plant various citrus fruits to earn extra income.  He is thankful for the support and trust that Afodenic gives through Kiva funds to many farmers like him to be able to start planting on time to improve the quality and, above all, the natural flavor of their crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Josephina Tiwanac Group

texts.en:
Josephina is married and has five children. Josephina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Josephina is a farmer and grows corn and rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase three sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

Josephina has been a member of PMPC for a month. 

Josephina is the leader of a five person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Remigio Antonio

texts.es: El señor  Remigio , es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejor las condiciones de vida y sobre todo apoyarlos lo mas que pueda en sus estudios para que puedan ser alguien en la vida ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad porque sus padres son muy pobres y no le podían dar estudios , don Remigio desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatirlas , los planes futuros hacia el cultivo es poder varia la plantación de piña ya que actualmente son tiene la especie llamada mote lirio . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para un mejor desarrollo hacia el sector agrícola .
texts.en:
Señor  Remigio has a small farm together with his family, in the Ticuantepe area.  His plans for the future are to be able to improve his living conditions, and above all to support his children as much as possible in their studies so that they can become somebody.  He never had this opportunity himself, because his parents are very poor, and could not provide him with an education.

Don Remigio has been growing pineapple for several years. The biggest challenges he faces are the infestations that affect his crops, as he lacks the fertilizers and supplies necessary to combat them.  

His future plans for his farming is to be able to vary the pineapples he grows on his plantation, as he currently grows the Mote Lirio species.

He is grateful for the support that Afodenic is providing through Kiva, for better development in the agricultural sector.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Gemma Group

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in Nangcaan, Rizal. She is married and has two children. 

Gemma has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately 3200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. 

Gemma has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve the general living situation of her family. 

Gemma is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 48 years old and lives in Casul, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with no children. 

Cornelia has a general store that sells assorted items. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase assorted stocks worth 25,000 PHP and 30 cases of coke. 

Cornelia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase inventory, including 30 cases of coke

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is married with 8 children. Concordia is 55 years of age and she lives in Pulang Yuta,Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Concordia has a stall lin their barangay market and she sells variety of products and had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000.00 to purchase goods additional for her  business.
 
Concordia has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Concordia hopes that with the help of GDMPC she can have her own stall and not to rent anymore.

loans.use: to purchase goods additional to sell

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is 34 years old and lives in Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is married and has one child.  To earn a living, Verna has a business selling sausage. 

Verna earns about 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month from her business, and she has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for more than three years.  Verna plans to use the proceeds of this 50,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients to make her sausage.  In the future, Verna would like to have her own small sausage-making factory.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her sausage

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married with three children. She is 25 years old and lives in Poblacion, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte.

Amalia buys and sells scrap metals to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Amalia going to the nearby villages to buy scrap metals. She buys metals, bottles, used electric wires and others and she sell it to her Junk Shop contract buyer Each month, she earns PHP 2,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000.00 to buy scrap metals.

Amalia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Amalia wishes to have a motorcycle. So, she can have a ride and use for the delivery of her products.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Mr. Thuch and his wife have four lovely children who are living under their care. Some of the children are studying at a local senior high school. Mr. Thuch wishes to send them to a good university in Phnom Penh after they finish high school. Thus, Mr. Thuch and his wife have to work hard and save some money for payments to the university in the next few years. 

Mr. Thuch lives in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. He earns a living by breeding cows, both for meat and offspring. He has been in this business for 13 years with his wife, who always assists him on their farm. His wife also shares her time raising some piglets at home for more income. This conscientious couple works tirelessly towards their dream of having a good quality of life. Together, they earn around $15 US per day for the household expenses. 

Mr. Thuch would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy more cows for breeding. With the rest of the loan, he will purchase some feed for fattening his pigs.

loans.use: to buy more cows for breeding and to purchase some feed for fattening his pigs.

loans.name: Ma.lora

texts.en:
Ma. Lora, 42, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Lora has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Lora requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Lora has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Ma. Lora would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 37 years old and married. She has three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 19 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mariglen

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mariglen works hard to support her family.

She has a rope-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.  Mariglen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Mariglen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fruit in her stall.

Susana has been in this business for 4 years. Susana earns more income from farming rice.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Wilhelmin

texts.en:
Wilhelmin is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Wilhelmin has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Wilhelmin aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Melorna

texts.en:
Melorna is 41 years old and married with 3 children. With all 3 children in school, Melorna works very hard to provide for them.

Melorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods and grocery items. 

In the future Melorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Grace is married and has three children. Grace is 45 years old and lives in Mahayag. 

Grace sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. 

Grace has been a member of PMPC for two years. Grace is the leader of a four person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she earns more income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Leonarda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for 10 years.

Teresita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell at her store. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell at her store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida is 36 years old and has one child who is in school.

Aida has a shell-crafting business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like screen, wire and nylon for her business.

Aida has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like screen, wire and nylon for her shell crafts.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 38 years old and lives with her son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in her sister's yard in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son is a student in public school. She started her business in 2002 by selling women's clothes and leggings in the streets. Now she rents a counter in a market. She is very well experienced and has many regular customers. She has a vision to expand her business by renting multiple counters in a multiple markets. She is a hard working and diligent woman who says, "I have vision to expand my business and to finish my boy's college." She is requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase underwear for her business.

loans.use: To purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo, a 48-year-old married mother of one child who is in school, has been farming vegetables in the Philippines for 10 years now. Having borrowed  and repaid 10 loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a new one for PHP 14,000 to purchase a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden. In the future, Amparo would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from copra. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, a 47-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom is in school, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for three years now. Having already borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF, she is now requesting  a new one for PHP 18,000 to purchase medicines, vaccines and feeds for her pigs. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase medicines, vaccines and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old, widowed, and has twelve children. 

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like seasonings, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store.

She has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for eleven years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Emelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and is married with six children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Helen has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan request. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from computer games.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is 50 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her children are living separately. Her husband is currently unemployed and is hospitalized after injuring himself at the construction site. She started her business in 2002 by buying animals from the countryside and selling them in the city and local town. She has managed this business for 9 years and she gained lots of work and business experience. She has a car and collects livestock with her car. After collecting several animals, she sells them in the city once or twice a month. Her husband also helps her to manage the business. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says "I want to live in the countryside. There, I want to have several animals to herd." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy 20 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en:
Heraclea, 54, is married and has ten children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Heraclea has a broom-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials to make brooms.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Heraclea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her brooms.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving business.

Janice has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from copra.

Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Arriza

texts.en:
Arriza is 40 years old, married, and has seven children.

Arriza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her store.

She has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for a year and also earns an income from fish vending (selling).

Arriza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy aims to improve her business to increase her income. She manages a general store where she sells grocery items in the local community. She is also raising pigs as an additional source of income. With patience, she believes she will be able to grow her businesses and make them viable in the long run. 

She wants to ask for a loan of P25,000 to buy groceries, such as biscuits, canned goods and noodles, to sell, and to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

Daisy is now 30 years old, single, and lives with her family. Because of her determination to improve her family's living situation, she does everything to attain a prosperous living in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as biscuits, canned goods and noodles to sell and to buy feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emerita works hard to support her family.

She has a meat selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food selling.  Emerita is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nineteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a 37-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. She has been selling beauty products in the Philippines for the past 13 years and also earns income from operating a sari sari store and providing electronic re-loading services.

Having previously borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF, Florence is requesting a new one for PHP 25000 to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal is 48 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her children are high school and college students. Her husband works as a clerk at the local high school. 

She started her business in 2000 by planting vegetables at her home. She has many years of business and work experience. Her family supports her business. She is planning to expand her business activities. She just bought 20 chickens to start a chicken farm. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "With the bank loan, I want to expand my business and improve my life. In the future, I also want to buy a car for the family. Like this I have many plans."

She is requesting a 1,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to transport the vegetables to the city of Ulaanbaatar and sell them.

loans.use: To transport the vegetables to Ulaanbaatar and sell them

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.  Rebecca has been in this business for four years.  Rebecca also earns income from motorcycle transport.  Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities with the help of the loans from NWTF.  Her dream is to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Reymonda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Reymonda works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. Reymonda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Reymonda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorycle maintenance.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials for her abaca weaving business. Lorena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma's source of income comes from raising crops. Together with her spouse, they have engaged in these activities for almost 20 years. They plant and harvest rice and sell it to traders in the village. The couple earns a yield twice a year during the months of May and November. Felma is continuously generating income for the education of her only child. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides used in farming. 

She hopes to improve her crop production. 

Felma would like to achieve plentiful harvests and someday make her family financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Sherlita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Sherlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana works hard to support her family. Vitaliana is married and has a food productions/sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. Vitaliana has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Vitaliana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional clothing to sell for her ready-to-wear business.  Erlinda has been in this business for two years. Erlinda earns additional income from fishing.  Erlinda sustains her business activities by her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF.  Her dream is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar is 26 years old and lives with her two sisters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the city of Ulaanbaatar in Mongolia. She just bought some land and a ger. 

She started her business in 2010 by becoming a member of Oriflame beauty product community. Her income and business activity have increased very well since then. She plans to expand her business and she is going to buy a skin-identifying machine. 

She graduated from Ih Zasag University, majored in accounting. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "I want to expand my business and improve my life. I did this somehow in the last year with Oriflame." She is requesting a 1,500,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to buy the skin-identifying machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy a skin-identifying machine

loans.name: Vannet

texts.en:
Vannet (in the photo) is 32 years old and her husband Yat is 39 years old. They have been married since 1994 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One is in school and other three are still young. The family lives in a village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vannet sells grocery items at home, while her husband is a construction worker. Vannet wants to generate income by investing with her mother to buy sugar cane under contract for sale. 

Hence Vannet is asking for her fist loan of $550 to help her capital.

loans.use: To invest with her mother to purchase sugar cane for sale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 53 years old and married with six children.  She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines.  Myrna is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase medicine and vaccines for her pigs.  Myrna has been raising pigs for 15 years.  She earns additional income buying and selling cosmetic products.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh was born in 1975. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, Duc Tu commune. She has two children. Her husband is a carpenter in her workshop. She has been working there and helps her husband in her free time, but her main job is selling pork in the market. 

Her family has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and always repays loans punctually. This is the sixth time she has borrowed money from SEDA. At this time, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn and his wife, Chanthy, have been married since 1995 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three are in school and another one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yoeurn and his wife are rice farmers. He also drives a motor taxi when he is not at the farm. He is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm. 

Photo: Yoeurn and his wife at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly (in the photo) is a weaver. Her husband sells cows. He buys cows from the nearby district and sells to a middleman who comes to buy cows from him at his house. The couple has been married since 2001 and has one daughter, who attends school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokly is in the process of building a new house to stay in. However, she lacks some money to complete it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to complete the build.

loans.use: To complete building her house.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 38 years old and married with two children.  Cynthia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.  Cynthia has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.  Cynthia aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old. married, and has six children.  She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has done for eight years, and works hard to provide for her family. 

Lolita is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.  Lolita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She also earns an income from buying and selling rice.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari stores

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 44 years old and is married with four children.

Mary Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Mary Joy has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Mary Joy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is 41 years old and his wife Somnang is 42 years old (pictured together), have been married since 1991 and have five children-four sons and one daughter. The family is living in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saroeurn wants buy cows to raise. When the cows give birth, she will be able to get income from selling the calves or when the cows grow to full size, or she will be able to sell the cows for beef. 

Hence Saroeurn is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cows.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 41 years old and lives with her children and mother in a Ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her daughter is a high school student. 
Byambasuren started her business of selling grocery products and goods in 2010. In 2011, she got a job at the local post office. She manages her job and private business very well. She is well-known in her local town. She is expanding her business little by little. She believes that her business will be successful in the near future. She is a diligent and hard working woman. 
She says "With the bank loan, I want to expand my business and improve my life. I think my business will grow." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old, married and has six grown-up children. Rice and corn production is the primary source of income in the barrio (district) where Corazon and her family live. She has been engaged in rice farming for almost 20 years. Together with her spouse, she plants and harvests rice to sell to traders in the barrio. 

Corazon would like to ask for a loan of P10,000 to pay the laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings on the farm. She also needs to pay additional laborers because they were not capable of doing all the activities on the farm such as sowing, tilling and transplanting rice seedlings.

She hopes to save enough money to use when emergencies arise because they are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to pay the laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings on the farm.

loans.name: Turmunh

texts.en:
Turmunh is 48 years old and lives with his wife and children in a ger in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife has a private business and his two children are high school students. 

Turmunh started his business in 2006 by making Mongolian traditional shoes and biscuits at his home. He has many years of work and business experience. He is planning to expand his business activity. Turmunh is a diligent and hard working man who says "with the bank loan, I want to expand my business and increase my business income. Also I will need to pay the college tuition fees of my children soon." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy raw materials for biscuits and shoes.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for biscuits and shoes

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom (pictured above) is 28 years old and her husband Phat is 31 years old. They live in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. The couple has been married since 1999 and has two young daughters. 

Mom sells fish and vegetables in Phnom Penh market, while her husband Phat is a driver for a company.  Mom wants to buy her own space at the market, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $1,200.

loans.use: to purchase a space for a shop to sell fish.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites lives simply with her husband and four school aged children in their community. She is an industrious wife and has operated her sewing business for almost a year. From the business she gets money for their everyday expenses as well as payment for their electric bills. This causes her to work hard and strive for more.

As she stated, “it would be difficult to experience scarcity for the rest of our lives.” Hence the 48-year-old woman is requesting a loan amount of P5,000 to buy fabric, threads, needles and scissors. She hopes these will help increase her income every month so she will be able to provide a more comfortable living for her family and not experience a poor living forever.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles and scissors

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 42-years-old and lives with her daughter and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in  the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a clerk at the mining company. Her daughter works as a waitress at the local restaurant. 

She started her business in 1995 by selling clothes at the Denj market. She increased her turnover capital successfully and now she has clothes worth over 3,5 million MNT. She has many years of work and business experience. In the future, she plans to expand her business activity by renting another commercial space at the other market. She is a diligent and hard working woman who says, "I want to expand my business and open new branch." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes and increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Dam

texts.en:
Dam was born in 1964. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, Duc Tu commune. She has two children, one of whom was married. She not only grows rice but she also sells fish in the market. 

She has this job for three years. Her husband is a carpenter. He works in his wood workshop with Dam's help. They have a monthly income of about 7.000.000 Vietnamdong. Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA and always pays loan punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 8.066.000 VND to buy fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Khom, is a construction worker and rice farmer. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1972 and have seven married children-three sons and four daughters.

Sokhoeun is asking for another loan of $400 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 27-year-old who is engaged in the buying and selling of fish.  She already has two years in this kind of business and it has been serving as a source of income for their daily expenses. No day has passed that she would not sell in their community carrying her fish and weighing scale. Even though it is difficult for her, she still continues dealing to her customers and it feels good when she sells all her fishes. She sacrifices for her her two children.

She wanted to lessen her burden and reduce her difficulty in selling as she used to walk every day to get income through fish selling. For this reason,she is asking a loan amount of P5,000 to buy additional fishes of different types to sell in order to earn a higher income than the usual so she could save enough money for her dream service.

She is dreaming to buy a motorcycle that will help her in selling fish every day. She hopes this will be achieved as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy additional fishes of different types to sell.

loans.name: Elynor

texts.en:
Elynor is 32-years-old and blessed with two children. To make a living she is working as a manicurist and pedicurist in their community. She roams house to house to look for customer in need of her service. This is her method every day to make a profit. 

Because of poor living in their village, she simply asks rice as her payment. Then through that barter system, she is acquiring customers at the same time, earning income to lift her family from poverty. 

She is now asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy new kits for her service business such as cuticle remover, nail polish, pusher and nipper used to provide a good quality service. These would be a great help to provide better customer service for her clients and to earn a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy new kits for her service business such as cuticle remover, nail polish, pusher and nipper used to provide a good quality service.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien was born in 1982. She lives in Luc Canh village. She has two children who are still small. She has a general store at home. She sells groceries for everybody in her village. She also raises chickens and grows rice. Her husband helps her with everything. She hasn’t got a lot of money but she feels happy. Her family has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She and her husband always try to earn money to have a better life. Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA to borrow money. The last time she borrowed 8.066.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy groceries for her general store (cake, candy, cigarettes.)

loans.use: to buy groceries for her general store (cake, candy, cigarettes.)

loans.name: Sherylle

texts.en:
At the age of 34, Sherylle is now a mother of four children. To provide them a better living, she is operating a motorcycle as a source of income. This is her occupation at day time and a "balot" vendor at night. She is asking for a loan amount of P5,000 for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle and part of it will be used for her "balot" business.

She is striving hard to send all her children to school until they finished their desired courses. The lack of sleep and difficulty as a motorcycle operator does not discourage her to continue life; instead, it serves as her driving force in order to achieve success in the future.

loans.use: for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle; part of it will be used to her "balot" business.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1984. She lives in Luc Canh village. She is married. She has a daughter who is small. Her husband is a worker. Not only does she grow rice, but also she sells fast food in the market. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND.

About the other borrowers in her group.

Tam is 50 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Hoa is 40 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her store.

Dung is 23 years old. He is alone. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed poultry.

loans.use: to buy fast food to resell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita owns a retail business selling various stock such as instant noodles, sugar, soaps, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods and other kinds of basic needs. She has been running her business for six years.

According to Carmelita, the income generated from the business enables her to support her five children in covering their daily needs and household expenses. She plans to add more stock requested by the customers but she needs additional capital to do so. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits and other basic needs for her store. She is hoping that she could obtain her requested loan to be able to expand the store and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits and other basic needs for her store.

loans.name: Dinalyn

texts.en:
Dinalyn is 47 years old and is currently engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells canned goods, candies, instant noodles and breads. She has been in this business for five years and earning a net income of P5,000 every month.

She wishes to expand her income, so Dinalyn is requesting a loan amount P5,000 to buy cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce as additional goods in her business. Dinalyn is looking forward to when her income will exceed the normal amount so that she can easily acquire a better living as well as provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce as additional goods in her business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mr. Long is 52 years old, a married man and a father of seven lovely kids, two of whom are already married and have started to live in separate houses. The other five of them are living on his income and are attending in school. Mr. Long is a hard-working person who supports his family’s needs. Presently, he is a good teacher in secondary school level. He has been in this field for many years. Taking time from this business, he also a rice cultivator, located in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meancheay Province, Cambodia. It is the one skill which he had learned more from his parents and ancestors since he was young. He has planted it for a few months but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer and crop plague. Because of this, Mr. Long would like to request in amount of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for making his product grow well. He said that this fund is very useful for his family because it is the main source of his income. He is hoping that all kind donors will take pity on his family. He said that he is an easygoing person, conscientious and will pay back punctually. In the future, he will send his children to get a good education at university and get a good job for each.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora devotes herself full-time to managing her fish selling business in the public market. She inherited this business from her parents. She had been managing it for almost 20 years. She decided to rent a stall in the public market to have a more convenient place to sell fish to her customers. She usually earns a monthly profit of P20,000. Profits earned went to stall rentals, electric bills, meals and school fees.

Melchora has four children and she has been separated from her spouse for six years.

She is now requesting for a loan of P10,000 to buy additional items such as fish, pork meat, and chickens to dress and sell in the market. She would like to increase her sales and keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fish, pork meat, and chickens to dress and sell in the market

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 25 years old and studied college but was not able to finished her courses due to financial difficulty. At this time, she has three children and to support their needs, she is engaged in selling vegetables and at the same time managing a store. She wants to earn money for the future studies of her children. She doesn’t want them to be like her, who doesn't finish her studies.

Now, she is asking a loan amount of P5,000 to buy seeds such as eggplant, squash and beans to plant in their backyard. Part of it will be used to purchase grocery items for her store stock of goods to sell. She hopes that through these businesses, she can lift her poor living from poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds such as eggplant, squash and beans to plant.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery store business. She started this business to support her family financially.

She is married and a mother of two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a painter by profession. He paints on buildings, walls and houses, etc.

With the loan, she will buy groceries such as spices, sugar, lentils in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill the client’s demand on time and increase her sales and income.

She is an experienced businesswoman and has been operating her business for past 10 years. She is confident that an investment will increase her profits.

Note: One of the members has an embroidery business - that is why they are holding embroider cloth.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is an entrepreneur and has been running her fish selling business for almost 10 years. She is widowed and has three children. Since the demand for fish has been steadily increasing, Gemma would like to take out a loan amounting to P7,000 to purchase more fish wholesale which will enable her to increase her profit and attract more custumers to buy her products. She hopes that through her business, she can be a successful entrepreneur someday. Gemma would be thankful if her requested loan is approved, so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing more fish to sell within the community.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 3 kids in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband builds houses and helps her part time. Two kids are in school and the other one is in kindergarden. She started her business in 2000 by sewing deel, the Mongolian traditional wear in remote areas.  In 2010, she started running a tailoring business in a central area of the province and became well known for her sewing skill. She is a capable and responsible woman who says "I love what I do and more importantly, people acknowledge my work".  She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy more sewing materials.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Her daughter is only 2 years old, while her sons are getting their education. 
Her husband is a watchman by profession. His income is not enough for fulfilling the needs of the family.  A few years ago, Shaheen started a sewing business to share the financial burden with her husband. She receives orders from her clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders in less time and increase her profits. 
She has 6 years of experience in her work and she is confident that an investment will bring more profits to her and help her establish her business. 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz is the leader of this group. She is 33, and together with her husband she runs a private business. She has two daughters and a son. 
All the children study at school.  Nine years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Gulnaz opened a computer saloon. In the beginning, she had six computers.  Now she has increased its number to fifteen. She also purchased a printer and a Xerox. At the moment, she needs additional funds to purchase spare parts to update the computers in the saloon. In the future, Gulnaz plans to repair the saloon, and, with the profits gained from the business, she wishes to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Chimed

texts.en: Chimed is a 37 years old and lives with his wife and 4 kids in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He is a professional plumber and he does it part time. His wife helps with his clothing trading business.  Two kids are in school and 2 others are in day care. He started his business in 2005 by renting a counter in a market to sell garments. He is very well known for his stylish and high-quality clothes. He is a capable and diligent man who says "I love what I do, I live a fulfilled life and I have a bright vision for my kids to graduate college " He is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to buy winter clothes and to increase his assets.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok, a resident of Kompong Chhnang province, has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops on her inherited farmland. Mrs. Sok can earn an average of $1.50 per day from her farming. She is married, with seven children. All of her children finished high school, and they can earn a living for themselves. Nowadays, Mrs. Sok lives with her last-born child and her husband, whose job is a construction worker. Mrs. Sok wishes to build a bigger house for a comfortable living yet she does not have enough money to buy a plot of land for that purpose. That is why Mrs. Sok would like to borrow some funds from Kiva, through HKL.  She will use them to purchase the land, which can be used to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for building a house.

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur lives with his wife and kid in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in his father's yard in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He is recently married and just got a baby. His wife used to help with his business but due to her recent birth, she is not able to help him; instead, she take cares their baby. He started his coal reselling business in 2009; however, due to his recent marriage, he spent a lot of money, and he is willing to increase his asset. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I have a lot of responsibility now. I need to support my wife and child." He is requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more coal.

loans.use: To purchase more coal.

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en: Badamtsetseg is 48 years old and lives with her two sons in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband died five years ago, and two kids are in college. She used to be a clerk, but then she built a small grocery shop in her yard, which is beside the main road, in 2009. She is good with numbers and she is very experienced in her business. Her shop has a good location and has good potential. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "It has been [a] difficult past few years due to my late husband, however I've never given up and never will." She is requesting a 2,150,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more grocery items to broaden the range of products in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 47-year-old widow; she lost her husband a few years ago as a result of a sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her, but she never gave up and supported her children by sewing clothes. She has acquired good skills, which helps her in receiving a good number of orders every month. 
She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Now her son is a driver and her daughter is a schoolteacher. They both financially contribute to the family from their earnings. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother, who operates a grocery store in the market. With the loan, he will put a larger quantity of groceries in his store and increase his sales. He is well known for his good behavior with customers and has been operating his business for the past 10 years. 

Naseem is hopeful that an investment will help him to expand his business and make it more profitable. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her second loan application. She has proved herself as a responsible client in her first loan year by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Heam is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her humble husband and two lovely children in Kompot Province. It's an area where agribusiness is common; the majority of the region's inhabitants own rice, cattle, and fishing businesses. She is a lovely mother who always takes care of her family and provides a good education to her children. She is married to Mr. Chab, who is a fisherman. He has been in this business since 1990. Because he has a lot of experience as a fisherman, he is able to get a lot of fish to his wife every day. From this industry, he is able to earn approximately 4 USD each day. 

Hoping to have a better quality of life, she and her husband have decided to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner with Kiva. They will use the loan to purchase additional fishing materials. She says that having the support and help of her husband makes it possible for her to live a life of comfort, happiness, and prosperity. Moreover, she commits to paying back the loan punctually to kind lenders. She and her husband are very thankful to all lenders that always help their family stay above the poverty line. This is the second cycle of her loan with HKL and her first loan with Kiva. She does not use another bank in addition to HKL because it is the one micro-finance institution that provides lower interest, good services, and long-term periods.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Avdoldo

texts.en: Avdoldo is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt. They live in Hovd province of Mongolia. Avdoldo operates a business selling clothes. His wife helps with the business, and his two children are in kindergarden. He started his business in 2010. He buys garments from China and sells them. His business is going so well, but he needs some help to increase his inventory. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I am surprised by the progress of my business, and I want to broaden my range of products." He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien was born in 1965. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune, D. Anh district. She has three children who are going to school. Her husband has been in the army for many years. He earns a monthly income. He usually stays with the army, but sometimes he comes home to visit his family. Because her husband is often away, Mrs. Lien has to care for her children alone. She grows rice and operates a general store out of her home where she sells groceries. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and has repaid loans punctually. She is the leader of a 5-member group loan from SEDA. At this time she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy tables and chairs to expand her general store.

About other borrowers in her group:
Cam is 42 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Xuan is 57 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy chicken feed.
Hiep is 46 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Nu is 31 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her general store.

loans.name: Kishimjan's Group

texts.en:
Kishimjan is the leader of this group. She is 25 years old. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 50000 soms, she started her own business. She sells women's clothes made of Kyrgyz national fabrics and materials. Her mother helps her in running the business. In two years, Kishimjan has achieved good results. She increased the commodity turnover, and now her monthly profit is about 20000 soms. At the moment, Kishimjan has decided to invest money in livestock. She wants to purchase lambs for breeding, but she needs some additional funds. Thus, she applied for the loan. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase lambs for breeding. In the future, she dreams of opening her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase lambs for breeding.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan, who is 25 years old, is a resident who comes from the Kompong Chhnang province. She is married with two children between the ages of 3 and 10.  Mrs. Chan has been working as a garment factory worker since the factory was created in the province. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a domestic rice farmer and fisherman. He fishes in the pond and river in his village. Mrs. Chan usually works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day. From her job, she is able earn an income of around $2 (USD) each day for supporting the family’s needs. Mrs. Chan would like to request a loan in order to buy a new net and other fishing materials to support her husband in his fishing activity. In the future, Mrs. Chan hopes she can increase her income to buy some vegetables, meats and a few fresh fish to sell in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy a new net and other fishing materials to support her husband in his fishing activity.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Samnang, who is 27 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory, and he earns $4 per day. They have one child, a boy who is one year old. Every month, Samnang has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy school materials and pay for herself and her husband to study in Korea so that they can have a chance to work in Korea. The reason that they want to leave Cambodia to work in Korea is they can make better salaries in Korea. Samnang has a plan to open a massage shop in her province when she can earn a better income. If she and her husband can have the opportunity to work in Korea, the mother has agreed to look after their child.

loans.use: to buy school materials and pay for herself and her husband to study in Korea.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Sophat is 28 years old. She has a plantation where she plants vegetables, beans, chili and sesame. She earns around $8 per day. Her husband is a primary teacher who earns $4 per day. They have three children; two are studying and one is too small to go to school. Every month, Sophat spends $60 on food, $7 on electricity, $25 on a school fee and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a hand tractor for plowing the land for plantation. Aside from her plantation work, Sophat also sells some grocery goods at her house. However, that career has not provided a good income. She plans to plant more vegetables when she can earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for plowing the land for plantation.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren is 38 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a Mongolian ger. The ger is located in her mother's yard in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker. They have two children in school and two in kindergarten. Byambasuren started her business in 1991 by renting a small space in the city of Erdenet to run her tailoring business. In early 2011, she moved back to her hometown in the Huvsgul province. Even though she just moved back to her hometown recently, she already has some regular customers. She even sewed the local orchestra's uniforms. She is a skilled and hardworking woman who says,"Everything is going so well and it is very nice to start a new beginning, especially in my hometown." She is requesting 1,700,000 MNT to purchase tailoring materials.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 34 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $2.70 per day. Her husband is a chief construction worker and earns about $13 per day. They have three children, all of whom are in school studying. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $8 on electricity, and $40 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy dirt to fill her land which is flooding. This loan will allow her family to avoid flooding. She plans to extend her husband's career by helping him to buy more construction equipment and materials so that he can provide better service to the customers than now. She hopes to send all of her children to study at least until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy dirt to fill around her house to avoid flooding.
