loans.name: Samay

texts.en:
Samay, 32 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3.30 per day. Her husband is a transport worker who earns about $2 per day. They have two children, both of whom are in school studying. Every month, Samay has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motor taxi driver when he is free from work. She wants to open a tailoring shop at her house, but this is a long term plan. She can’t effort to do it right now.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to do motor taxi work.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin, 52 years old, is an ice cream seller who, with her husband, earns about $8 per day. They have four children. Two are studying and the other two are working in the factory, each earning $4 per day. Every month, Sin has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy steel and cement for repairing her house, and the rest of the money she will spend for her business of selling ice cream. The couple started doing this business a long time ago, and she plans to extend her career to sell more ice cream and open a small shop so that they don’t have to sell it from the motorbike.

loans.use: To buy steel and cement for repairing her house.

loans.name: Munhbaatar

texts.en:
Munhbaatar lives with her mother in a ger, the traditional Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her mother is old and stays at home. She started her business in 2006 by renting a counter in a local market to sell commodities such as kitchen implements, toilet service, etc. 

During the summer, she sells his goods across the countryside. She started her business from scratch and now she has her own home. She is very skilled and talented at her business. In the future, she is willing to expand her business. She is a skilled and experienced women who says, "I am very good at what I do and I want to expand my business." She is requesting 3,600,000 MNT to purchase more goods and to increase her assets.

loans.use: To purchase more goods.

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel is a flexible person. To generate income, she provides laundry services to the people in her village as part time work and earns a daily profit. Aside from laundry services, she also plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders when she harvests. She earns about P15,000 each cropping season. She has been in this business for 10 years together with her spouse. 

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in rice farming. She hopes to improve her crop production and earn a higher income.

She is now 31 years old and has two children attending school. She would like to continuously provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in rice farming.

loans.name: Siyan

texts.en: Siyan, 22 year old, is a garment factory worker who earns $4 per day. Her husband also works at the factory and earns $4 per day. The couple does not have any children yet. She lives with her mother and some of her brothers and sisters. Every month, she has to spend $102 on food, $5 electricity, $10 on house rent, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. The couple doesn't have any plans yet to change their job or do any business at this time, because they think their salaries can support the family well.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Tein

texts.en: Tein, 59 years old, is a fortune teller who earns $2.5 per day. She is a single mother living with one daughter and three grandsons, two of whom are studying and one who is too young to be in school. Her daughter is working at the factory earning $2.6 per day. Every month, Tein has to spend $50 on food, $6 on electricity and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 for her daughter to buy cosmetic products to sell in front of her house when she rests from work. Tein doesn’t wants to change her career but she wants to help her daughter to have a better cosmetic shop so that she can attract customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Tun

texts.en: Mrs. Tun is a 58-year-old woman who has been living in Kompong Chhnang province. She is involved in an agricultural business, cultivating rice crops. Her husband has the same business as her. During the rainy season of the year, this couple has a lot of to do on their farmland from dawn to dusk. Together, they typically earn about $2.5 USD per day. This income is not enough to cover the household's financial needs, no matter how hardworking they are. To increase their income, Mrs. Tun has decided to send her two daughters to work in a garment factory from which they can get a salary of around $50 USD per person. Currently Mrs. Tun is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy some fishing tools (net, lines, poles, hooks) to use for catching fish during the rainy season. Mrs. Tun said that this loan would help the family cut down on some food expenses. For the future, Mrs. Tun wants her two daughters to become tailors and own a small store in the village.

loans.use: to buy some fishing tools (net, lines, poles, hooks) for the use of catching fish.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 45 years old, is a worker (she was employed to work in a factory that produce fish product) who earns $2.8 per day. Her husband is also a worker earning $5 per day. They live with three children, two are studying and one is working at the border of Cambodia and Thailand earning about $5 per day. Every month, Phally has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity, $40 on school fees, and $14 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy grocery store goods for her daughter to sell. Her daughter is married and needs capital to start a business. Phally and her husband have been working as laborers for years because they don’t have any knowledge to do anther job. She hopes her daughter would do well in her new career so that they can support themselves.

loans.use: To buy grocery store goods for her daughter to sell

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 25 years old, is working in a cigarette company earning $7 per day. His wife has a pretty salon (a beauty shop) at home and earns $6 per day. The couple does not yet have any children. Every month, Vanna has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, and $49 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for transporting cigarettes to sell. The rest of the money, he will spend to extend his wife’s shop. In the future, he wants to extend his wife's shop so that she can provide more services to her customers and earn a better income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting cigarettes to sell

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 49 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband is selling food earning $3 per day. They live with only one child, he is 18 years old. He helps her to sell the groceries at home. Each month, she has to spend $83 on food, $5 on electricity, and $5 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more groceries to sell in her shop. She started this career about 7 years ago and she is able make some income to support the family, so she wants to extend her shop when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian, 32 years old, is a tailor who earns $10 per day. Her husband buys and resells motorbikes earning about $15 per day. They have three children, all of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $53 on food, $5 on electricity, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy plastic material to sell. This loan will help her to have another career to earn money. She plans to buy a plot of land to build a house for her family because right now they live with their parents.

loans.use: To buy plastic material to sell

loans.name: Akylbu's Group

texts.en:
Akylbu is the leader of this group. She is 46 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Both sons work in Bishkek and the daughter studies at school. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms,  Akylbu purchased cattle and since that time she is engaged in cattle breeding. She sells milk products and in this way she earns about 2000 soms per month to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan Akylbu wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding. In the future she wishes to build a new house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Зулайхо разводит мелко - рогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Zulaykho lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 51 years old, married and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  Zulaykho has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years.  She breeds small livestock for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is an industrious person. Though her family is less fortunate, she works hard to provide a good education for her children. She has eight children; five of them attend school and need daily allowances. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in rice farming for almost 10 years. They have a yield twice a year during the months of May and November.

Liezel has insufficient funds to buy herbicides and pesticides (chemicals used to kill unwanted herbs and pests that affect the growth of plants) used in rice farming. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000. 

In the future, Liezel would like to continuously send her children to college to earn a degree for better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a widow. Her husband left her alone with two daughters and two sons. 

Shameem is a brave lady, who never lost courage and started an electronics sales business. She sells televisions, fridges, and computers wholesale. Different shopkeepers purchase these items from her and she makes good income every month. 

Her elder daughter has graduated and works in a multinational company. Her elder son has a garment shop while the others are studying. 

Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her own business. With the loan, she will buy televisions and computers, etc. to sell. She has 10 years of experience in her business and she is confident that after the investment it will grow further. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy electronics (televisions, computers, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda runs a grocery shop. She would like to increase the variety of goods to meet her customer demand. With the requested loan, Imelda plans to purchase more goods to sell. Imelda will increase her working capital and expand her business in the future. With additional income, Imelda will be able to ensure a better future for her family. Imelda lives with her husband and her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and spices for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 46, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alex, a construction worker. They are blessed with one child who is currently studying in high school. She enjoys being a wife, a mother and a businesswoman. 

Alma owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 450 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan amounting to Php 15,000 that will help to continue her business well.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. It will also help her to attract more customers to buy household needs. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs.

Alma dreams that her sari-sari (variety) store will turn into a grocery someday. She hopes that she and her family will continue to have good health and a strong spiritual life. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week as the teachings and sharing of the word of God continues to enlighten and uplift her spirit. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a hardworking business woman aged 42. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last two years, she has been selling soft drinks to earn a living. She has grown her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  Previously, she was running a green grocer. Her desire is to expand her business into wholesale in five years. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy juice and soda for resale.

loans.use: To buy juice and soda

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is a resident and a framer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is aged 62 and married with four children aged between 21 and 11 and all in school. He has been in active farming for over 11 years and currently produces milk and vegetables for the local market. He fully relies on farming to cover his family needs.

Nicodemus has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry for a venture in poultry farming. He says this will improve his farming income since there is high demand for poultry which will enable him to provide for the family needs, especially for the education of the children, more easily .

He mentions lack of finances as a major challenge. He is happy with Juhudi Kilimo's services.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Eufrecina

texts.en:
Eufrecina is 51 years old. She is married to a farmer and has seven children. To make a living, she has been running her hog-raising business for one year and seven months. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them earning PHP 7,000 (Philippine pesos) per head. 

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps provide their daily needs. Now, Eufrecina wants to borrow PHP 16,000 to purchase feed and vaccine for her hogs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel, 36, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a construction worker. She helps her husband earn an income by doing her own business at home while attending to their children.  

Raquel operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 that will help to her to have additional capital. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. The more materials, the better so she can produce more of her products. The loan will help her to have additional rolling capital.

Raquel hopes that her business will grow more, that all of them will have good health and her children will be able to finish their studies. She values the time spent in the weekly fellowship* as it strengthen her faith in God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and other items needed in her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 51 years old and married with one adult-aged child. She has been engaged in the piggery business for six years. She said it is not easy work to take on this occupation. But because of the determination and inspiration that her child provides, she does everything for the benefit of their underprivileged lifestyle.

For that reason, Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to provide for the needs of her hogs by giving them better feed and vitamins. She is patiently growing her business into a bigger venture. She hopes that someday she will achieve her dream and lift her family from poor living.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a working lady who supports her family financially by doing sewing and embroidery works. She is very hard-working and knows the latest trends in fashion, that’s why she can provide good quality services to her clients and earns good profits. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transport services to his passengers. He is an expert in driving and his passengers trust his good driving skills. 

Nusrat has three sons and two daughters. Her sons have left their education and started doing different kind of works to financially contribute to the family and her daughters are studying in a local school. 

Nusrat is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who is involved in making wooden ladders. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails etc in larger quantity to make ladders in larger quantity to sell to his customers and increase his profits. He has good experience in his work and has been operating it for the past five years. Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will help him grow his business further and increase his monthly income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record in her previous loan and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails etc to make wooden ladders

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Marcelina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

In the future, Marcelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, and drinks

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a mother of five children, Merlita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a carinderia (a local eatery). Merlita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and is married with seven children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, snack foods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending and motorcycle transport.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, snack foods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan is a 30-year-old woman who has her own grocery store. Amani is requesting a loan of 800 JD  to expand her store and purchase more new products to sell.

Amani started her business years ago from home. Then with her exceptional hard work, she turned it into an established store near her home.

Amani's aspiration is to increase her sales volume and improve her family's living conditions.

Due to cultural issues, Amani refused to use her photo publicly so the man in the picture is her brother.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janet is 34 years old. Two of her children are in school.

Janet has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Janet requested a 19,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Janet has been in this business for five years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 37 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural industry, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elvira requested a 12,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elvira has been farming vegetables for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe is 40 years old and lives with his wife, a daughter and a son in Yerevan. Vahe’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children who are pupils.  Vahe has a high education in the economics sphere but he has never worked in any organization. For more than 17 years, he has been engaged in the clothes trading business. He imports women's clothes from neighboring countries and resells them in Yerevan. Vahe used to rent stalls in different clothes markets in Yerevan, but now he is renting a stall in the one of the biggest  trade center in Yerevan, which is the most comfortable and largest place for trade. Vahe prefers to sell women's clothes because in Yerevan it is in high demand and as he confessed, it is more pleasurable for him. Thanks to his business, Vahe solved his family's needs and bought new furniture and home appliances for their apartment. Vahe received loans from Nor Horizon 12 times and he has never delayed his repayments. Now Vahe needs a $3,000 loan to buy autumn and winter women's clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy autumn and winter women’s clothes to resell

loans.name: Ma. Erlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Erlinda is 52 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Ma. Erlinda is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a variety of seedlings and fertilizers.

Ma. Erlinda has been farming corn for 31 years and earns additional income from a variety store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to repair her family home and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 42-year-old illiterate, married lady. Her husband is a contractor and builds houses and buildings on contract. She is an embroidery expert and does decorative embroidery for her neighborhood clients on order. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.  She is the mother of two sons. The eldest one has the skills of an electrician but he doesn’t do it as a profession. He is interested in the driving profession. Her youngest one is a driver.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who will buy a rickshaw to fulfill his interest and start a driving business. Through the rickshaw, he will be able to provide transport services to the passengers and become the earning resource for the family. Gulzar is very confident about her son’s hard-working nature and she is very sure that an investment will help him make good profits from his business. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw to start a driving business

loans.name: Ma.consuelo

texts.en:
This is Ma. Consuelo, 60, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Arnel, a mason, and mother to their children. She, together with husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Consuelo operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Consuelo hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good future through all her hard work in her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Emma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. Emma has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent, and other groceries. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 43 years old. She is married and has seven children; some of her children have their own families. They live in Rang-ay Cabatuan, Isabela. She sells fish while her husband manages their rice fields. He also helps her with selling fish within their village. Julie uses her income to pay the electric bill and tuition fees and for her family's daily needs. 

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, Julie is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase fish such as tilapia and milk fish to sell. Julie hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business, she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fish such as tilapia and milk fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fish cage and to repair her fishing boat.

Lilia has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fish cage and to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Ulzii

texts.en: Ulzii is a 23-year-old man who lives with his sister and mother in a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. All family members help him to run the business. He started his business in 2009 by renting a computer and a counter to run a typing and printing service. Now he owns his own computer and printer, and he also sells stationery. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I started off small; however, I made it here and I see a very bright future in my business." He is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan (MNT) to purchase office supplies and to repair his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while one is already married. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of her family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

She has operated as a coconut seller for the past six years; her potential clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesaler.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase five sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to do business.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basima is a 41-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of 10 children. She makes "Maftol" which is a kind of traditional food in Jordan.

Basima is requesting a loan of 500 JD to expand her home-based project and purchase more materials needed to make more Maftol.

Basima is looking to purchase a machine for making Maftol so that she can increased her sales volume and increase her income to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to expand her project by purchasing more materials.

loans.name: Mehmooda's Group

texts.en:
Mehmooda works very hard along with her husband to put 3 meals on the table for her family. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skilled in her profession and prepares beautiful looking clothes. She is the mother of 7 children. Her 3 elder children left their education after 8th grade while others are enrolled in a local school and continuing their education. 

Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant. The taste of his food is very good and he has a good number of customers who come to his restaurant on a daily basis for lunch and dinner. 

Mehmooda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some furniture to provide better seating facilities for his clients and food making ingredients like spices, cooking oil, flour, etc. in bulk quantity. 

Mehmooda is very hopeful that an investment will help her husband in expanding his business and earning more profits.

loans.use: To buy furniture and food making ingredients for restaurant business.

loans.name: Ma.luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a 24,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing boat and other equipment for fishing. Ma. Luz has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Ma.  Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing boat and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan was born in 1982. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune. She is married. She has one child who is still small. Her husband is a policeman. He has an income. 

Not only does Ngan grow rice, but also she makes noodle (Vietnamese name is "bun"). She has had this job for two years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Since 2007 she has participated in SEDA. The last time she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy rice to make noodle.

loans.use: to buy rice to make noodle.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a 28-year-old man who recently married Asmaa, a 25-year-old lady.

Having experience in working as a barber led Muhannad to open his own barber shop three years ago. Now Muhannad has a very good business reputation in his neighborhood and that’s why he is looking now to work on expanding his barber shop and include more seats. In the future he wants to open a branch in another area.

loans.use: To work on expanding his barber shop and include more seats.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Norma has operated a retail shop for 5 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, coffee and spices for her store.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Jargalsaikhan is 35 years old and a mother of three teenage children. She lives with her husband and children in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent. Her children all attend a secondary school. Jargalsaikhan runs a baggage keeping business in the “Narantuul” International bazaar, the biggest Mongolian outdoor market. Her husband helps her with the business when he has a day off. 

She said their living condition is quite bad and she has been trying hard to get education to her three children and pay its or other expenses for a long time. Due to this, she made a plan which is aimed at increasing her earnings in phases. First, her business needs a vehicle to deliver the baggage to the customers from the other bazaars around the city. This is very important to her ongoing business and in order to expand successfully.  Jargalsaikhan is requesting a loan to purchase a vehicle in order to deliver the baggage to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle in order to deliver the baggage to her customers.

loans.name: Hekmat

texts.en:
Hekmat is a 59-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan with four children. She has an accessories and perfume shop and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to finance the purchasing of more products for her shop.

Hekmat is looking to expand her business and increase her living income.

loans.use: To expand her perfumes and accessories shop by purchasing more products.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old housewife as well as a working lady. In order to financially support her husband, she sells clothes as well as operates a beauty parlor at her home. She has done a diploma in beautician. Her husband is a vegetable seller. He sells fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers at reasonable rates. She has 3 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She knows the importance of education and wants her children to become successful in their lives by getting the latest education. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s vegetable business. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling to his clients for a profit. He started his business 3 years ago and Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will earn better profits for him.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen was born in 1960. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune. She has two children. One of them is married. Her husband has died. Her family life is difficult. Not only does she grow rice, but also she sells groceries to earn more money. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 vietnamdong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her general store by buying more groceries, like cake, candy, beer and fruit.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, like cake, candy, beer and fruit.

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en:
Ndunge is 59 years old and married to Pius, but not yet blessed with a child. She runs a poultry business and practices farming in the busy area of Tala market, which gives her the potential for clients and to make more profit. She has been in this business for the last twenty years and gets an income of about KES 20,000 per month.

Ndunge was introduced to KADET LTD by a client of KADET, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to purchase chicks and chicken mash. She will use the extra profit to save for her old age.

She hopes the business will be stable and that she can employ people while she manages it. She is a determined, hardworking lady who wants to see herself established.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to raise and chicken mash.

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en:
A 21-year-old lady, Jameeleh married Ayman, a 27-year-old baker with no children yet.

Jameeleh has always been into crafts, and after getting married she decided to use her talent and start her own small business at home in her free time, so she bought all the materiA. she needed such as straw and some types of accessories and started making baskets, straw trays, straw picture frames, and other items.

Selling her crafts has brought in some new orders, so she has applied for a loan to buy more materiA. and make new items from straw so she can have a new collection of products.

loans.use: to buy more material for making new craft items out of straw.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is married and her husband is 60 years old and stays at home. It is difficult for him to work at this older age. Shahnaz is a 46-year-old talented lady who sews clothes for her community clients in order to afford the living expenses of her family. 

She is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is an embroidery expert, her daughter is a seamstress and her 2nd son has a job. Her youngest son is 10 years old and studying in class 3. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, he will buy embroidery material in bulk that will allow him to make better quality embroidered clothes and earn more profits. He is very experienced in his work and has been operating his business for the past 10 years. Shahnaz has confidence in her son that he will make positive use of the investment and will be able to successfully upgrade his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shahnaz”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her son's embroidery business.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 32 years old. He is married, and the father of one child. He is a charcoal seller in Bamburi, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last two years. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this marks his second borrowing from KADET. With this loan he plans to add more bags of charcoal into his business. 

The anticipated profits will be generated into the repayment of the loan and the gradual expansion of his business. He hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to add more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 39, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Augusto, her business partner, and mother to their children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalinda hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams of having other stores in their area.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 39 years old. He is married and blessed with four children.He is a livestock trader and he has been doing this for the last five years. 


He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of dwelling. He repaid his previous loan well and this will be his third loan which he is planning to use to buy more livestock. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to venture into farming and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a finicky man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Gulbaara's Group

texts.en:
Gulbaara is the leader of this group.  She is 56 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised four children; two older sons are married and live separately with their families, the third son works in Korea and the youngest son is in Russia. 

Gulbaara works as a librarian, and when she has free time she is engaged wholesaling fruits and vegetables. In this way she earns about 4000 soms per month. She saved some money to start repairing her house, but she needs additional funds to purchase building materials, and for this purpose she has applied for the loan. In the future Gulbaara plans to open her own grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Farkhod

texts.ru: Фарход умный и решительный  молодой человек. Он уже 5 лет  занимается  куплей и продажей мужской одежды и обуви. Фарход живет вместе с родителями, отец помогает ему в бизнесе. Он приобретает товар на центральном рынке и продает на местном рынке. Фарход, чтобы привлечь клиента, старается хорошо обслужить их. Для развития бизнеса он хочет приобрести новые товары, впереди зима и потребность в  одежде и обуви возрастает. Фарходу  для покупки качественной одежды и обуви запрашивает  займ в размере 1700$США и надеется на вашу помощь и понимание
texts.en: Farkhod is a smart and decisive young person.  He has been involved in buying and selling men's clothing and shoes for five years.  Farkhod lives together with his parents, and his father helps him with the business.  Farkhod buys the merchandise at the central market and sells it at the local market.  In order to attract more customers, he tries to serve them well.  He wants to buy new merchandise in anticipation of the onset of winter and increased demand for clothing and shoes.  Farkhod is requesting a loan in the sum of $1700 to buy quality clothing and shoes and hopes to receive your help and understanding.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin, 39, is married woman. She lives with her three children in Kompong Chhnang province where she works as a basket maker. She has to buy strips of bamboo or bendable strips of wood from a local market, and then she uses her skills to weave them together to make baskets. From this business, she typically earns about $1.50 USD each day. However, she also relies on the income from her husband and daughter who work outdoors. 

Mrs. Yin has dreamed of having a general store to sell mixed products, yet she doesn’t have any capital to do that. She is asking for some funds and help from Kiva’s lenders in the sum of about $175 USD to build a store near her house to sell grocery products. With the increase in her income, she will support her children until they finish senior high school.

loans.use: to build a little store near her house.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is an embroidery expert. She crafts beautiful embroidery on clothes according to the latest trends and fashions and supports her family financially with the earnings. Her husband is a mason. He works on a contract basis. 

Farzana is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her sons have a glass items selling business. People give them orders to make glass items like windows, doors and tables for them. Her daughters help Farzana in finishing her embroidery orders on time. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her sons' business. With the loan they will purchase glass in larger quantity to finish the orders on time and earn maximum profit. They have been operating their business for the past 10 years and Farzana is hopeful that an investment will be profitable one for them. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy glass for glass item fabrication business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 56 years old and is currently in a relationship. She has four children.

Eufemia has for the last three years prepared and sold food. She makes lunch and breakfast. She started off small and then started to grow thanks to the recommendations of her customers to other people. In this way she grew her business a little at a time. She considers herself to be a good cook. She says that she starts preparing the food very early every day.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make her meals such as chicken, flour, noodles, rice and other products. In the future she hopes that she can establish a restaurant so that she can cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and spices used for cooking meals to sell.

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
Margarette manages a store within their local community. She is 35 years old, married and has been blessed with four children. All her children go to school so she works hard to provide for their daily needs. Her husband is supportive in running their business well. Margarette is thankful because her husband is responsible and has patience to strengthen their unity in maintaining their small business.

Margarette would like to ask for financial support in the amount of P 7,000 allowing her to buy more groceries for her store. This investment will improve her profit, and she will be able to show off her products to the customers. She hopes that she can buy additional products needed within their community.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her store.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Aslı is married with a seven-year-old son and a three-year old daughter. When she was in high school, she took an embroidery course and bought an embroidery machine. She first made embroidered things for her own trousseau and then started making items for other family members. Others around her liked her work and started giving her orders. From that, she says she expanded her customer base. After working for two years, she married, started a family and had to stop working.  Now that her children are getting older, her husband’s salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses. In order to find a way contribute to her family’s economy, she applied to Kiva partner Maya for a loan to start working again. 
With this loan, she wants to buy more supplies so she is able offer her customers a wider variety of products. In the future, she would like to provide other women with the opportunity to do this kind of work. She wants to provide her children with a good life and education so they will have a good future. Aslı is confident that she will be successful because once she decides to something, she does it.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Aslı evli ve 7 yaşında bir oğlu ve 3 yaşında bir kızı var.  Aslı lisedeyken,nakış kursuna gitti ve kendine nakış makinası aldı.  İlk önce nakış işlerini kendi çeyizi için yaptı ve daha sonra nakış işlerini kendi aile bireyleri için yapmaya başladı.  Bundan sonra Aslı'nın müşteri potansiyeli genişledi.  İki yıl çalıştıktan sonra,evlendi ve çocuk olduğu için çalışmaya ara verdi.  Şimdi çocuklar büyüdü,masraflar çoğaldı ve eşinin maaşı yetmemeye başladı.  Aile ekonomisine katkıda bulunmak için, tekrar iş yapmak için Maya kredisine başvurdu.  Bu aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini genişletmek istiyor.  İleride aynı işi yapacak kadınlara iş sağlamak istiyor.  İleride çocukları için iyi bir yaşam ve eğitim sağlamak istiyor.  Aslı Hanım  başarılı olacağına inanıyor çünkü kendine güvenen bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread, needles and other supplies.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat is 39 years old, married, father of three children. They live in his brother’s house. He has been running a grocery store for over five years. His wife works as a cashier at the store. Besides his store business, Erdenebat wants to start a new business of smokeless fuel sales (the Mongolian government suggests people to use it) in order to reduce air pollution in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He said that selling smokeless fuel is not very profitable, but he wants to keep the environment healthy and safe in the future. 
He is requesting a loan to purchase large amounts of smokeless fuel for sale from the the fuel suppliers.

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of smokeless fuel for sale from the the fuel suppliers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old, married and has six grown children. She has a personal products business in which she sells products like shoes, shampoo, lotions and dresses in the community.

Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional products that she can offer like lotions, toothpaste, dresses and bags.

Evelyn wishes to someday establish her own stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, lotion, shampoo and soap for her business.

loans.name: Katooke Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
James is a Ugandan man, age 49, who needs a loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale. A retail shop owner, he hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of seven children. 

He has had this business for eight years. He started as a farmer, growing Irish potatoes. He saved money and set up the shop. 

He dreams of growing his business to a wholesale business and educating his children.

He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1970. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune. 

Mai is single. She is a hairdresser. She has a barber shop at home. She has had this business for five years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. 

Since 2007 she has participated in SEDA and always repaid punctually. The last time she borrowed 8,502,000 VND to invest in her shop. 

In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to repair her barber shop.

loans.use: to repair her barber shop.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is a 51-year-old widow who lives with two lovely children whom she supports in Kompong Speu Province; it’s a zone where agribusiness is common. The majority of the region's inhabitants are in the cattle and rice business. 

Currently, she is a rice cultivator who works hard to cover her family’s needs. It is a skill that she had learned from her parents. She has been operating this business since 1979. What she wants to see is providing her family live in better quality of life. From this business, she is able to earn an average of $2 for each day for supporting her family's daily expenses. 

To upgrade their living Im would like to purchase a motorbike, but she is lacking some capital, so she wishes to request some funding through HKL, one of Kiva’s partners. 

She is hoping that generous lenders will provide a loan to her. She is very committed to pay back to donors punctually. She say that she is a conscientious, straightforward person. She is very grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her. She is shown with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 35 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 16. He has a small, well organized and clean boutique that he has owned for five years. It is open every day of the week between 6 a.m. and 10 p.m. and he employs two people to help him.

Juvenal will use his loan to purchase more soap, body lotion, juice and so on. He would like to save any profits to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, body lotion, juice, etc.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is very supportive lady who helps her husband financially by sewing clothes. She is well known in her community for her sewing skills and receives regular orders every month. She has no children. 

Her husband operates a fruit-selling business. He goes to the fruit market everyday early in the morning and buys fresh seasonal fruits for selling to his customers. 

He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and currently he is in need of money for buying fresh fruits in larger quantity. Therefore, Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. Her husband is very experienced in his business and Rehana is hopeful that an investment will bring his business to better and more profitable position. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 25 years old and married to Margaret, who runs a kiosk to bring some additional income to the family. They support a family of three people. He has a transportation business and he has been in this business for three years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 60,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000, with which he intends to purchase goats for resale. He plans to buy more goats for sale with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his first loan and his hopes are to buy a plot in Eldoret municipality and construct rental houses and also to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Noonkokua

texts.en:
Noonkokua, 36 years old, is a married  lady. She has three children who depend on her. She has been a farmer in Mau-Narok, Kenya, for six years with an income of about KES 6,000 per month.

She learned about KADET Ltd. through other women registered in her area of residence. She repaid a previous loan successfully and without complication. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd., and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William wants a loan to buy cows for rearing. 

Age 53 years, he hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of ten children age 30 to 2 with whom he lives, together with their mother, in a semi- permanent house. 

Having acquired his initial capital from the sale of part of his land, he has been a able to set up a cattle farm. 

He dreams of building a permanent residential house and diversifying into sugarcane growing.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Noselyn

texts.en:
This is Noselyn, 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, an overseas contract worker, and is mother to their children. She, together with husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Noselyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Noselyn hopes her business grows in the coming years and and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw currently runs on petrol which is very expensive, so he wants to install a CNG kit (set of components and tools that are installed in a vehicle so it can operate using both gasoline and compressed natural gas or CNG) on his rickshaw that will minimize his expenses and increase his rickshaw’s mileage. 
He has been providing transport services to passengers for the past 10 years and Fouzia is very confident that by utilizing the loan he will be able to run his business better and increase his profits. 
Fouzia is 33 years old and she has no children yet, so she spends most of her time doing decorative embroidery which earns her good profits every month. She learned this skill from her mother. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Fouzia”.

loans.use: To install a CNG kit in a rickhsaw

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a very hardworking 39-year-old widow with one child. Jane offers food and water to the residents of Mathare, Nairobi with her clients being both male and female. She has been in this business for the last eleven years and gets an income of KES.6,000 per month.

Jane is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy food items like cereals, onions, tomatoes, and maize flour. Jane hopes to expand her business and will use the extra profit for the expansion.

loans.use: To buy food items and water.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John wants a loan to harvest sugarcane and buy a drum to store local brew. Age 32, he hails from Kyenjojo District and is the father of six children between the ages of 1 and 7. He lives together with them and their mother in a semi-permanent house. Having inherited land from his father, he planted a sugarcane plantation of six acres. It is from the sugarcane that he makes local brew. He dreams of building a permanent residential house and buying a motorcycle to facilitate transportation of the local brew to the markets.

loans.use: to harvest sugarcane and buy a drum to store local brew

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her son's school fee

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 58 years old, married, and has one child. He is from Trinidad, Bohol. Raymundo has been a a seaweed farmer for five years, and he also buys and sells fish to people in his community.

Raymundo plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy straw, wooden pegs, and more fish to sell. He hope that in future he will be able to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden pegs, and more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Uguloi

texts.ru: Угулой  трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она  уже 7 лет занимается куплей и продажей мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. Угулой начала свою предпринимательскую деятельность с купли продажи кур. Она вдова у нее 5 детей. Старший сын помогает ей в бизнесе. Угулой приобретает  скот на базаре и в течении 20 дней занимается откормом, после продает их по более высокой цене. Этот  вид деятельности приносит прибыль семейному бюджету. Угулой так как вдова она думает о будущем своих детей. Для развития  и расширения бизнеса она хочет приобрести крупный и мелкий бизнес, но у Угулой нет нужной суммы. Она просит займ на сумму 2000$ США.  Угулой рассчитывает на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Uguloi is a hard-working and responsible woman.  She has been involved in buying and selling small livestock and cattle for seven years.  Uguloi started her entrepreneurship with buying and selling chickens.  She is a widow and has five children.  Her oldest son helps her with the business.  Uguloi buys livestock at a market, fattens it up over the course of 20 days and then sells it at higher prices.  This business bring in a profit for the family budget.  Because Uguloi is a widow, she thinks of her children's future.  In order to develop and expand her business, Uguloi wants to buy cattle and small livestock, but does not have the necessary funds for it.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  Uguloi counts on your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Duhurizehamwe/cymr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste fait partie du groupe Duhurizehamwe. Le nom du groupe signifie «mettons ensemble des forces   ». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant  de 3 ans, qui est scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est  3 ans de secondaire.

Jean Baptiste est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Baptiste voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour cultiver de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Baptiste belongs to the Duhurizehamwe group.  The name of the group means “we're joining forces.”  He is 32 years old, married and has one 3 year-old child who is in school.  His educational level is three years of secondary school. Jean Baptiste grows rice.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. His strategy for growing his business is to use selected strains of rice seeds.  In the coming years, Jean Baptiste would like to buy other fields for growing rice.  He plans to educate and care for his children with the profits.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Abahujumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Ezéchiel  fait partie du groupe Abahujumurimo. Le nom du groupe signifie «qui ont le même travail ». Il a 53 ans et il est marié avec 10 enfants de 6 à 31 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  3 ans de secondaire.

Ezéchiel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres champs de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Ezéchiel voudrait construire une de stock du riz et être le fournisseur de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ezéchiel is a member of Abahujumurimo Group, whose name means "who have the same job". He's 53 years old, married, and has ten children, aged 6 to 31. He attended middle school for three years.

Ezéchiel is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, in order to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy to grow his business is to buy other rice fields. In the forthcoming years, he would like stock rice and become a wholesaler.

With his profits, he intends to provide education and healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 years old and is married. She has been operating her food stall for four months, selling different kinds of vegetables and viands to her community. She buys her products at wholesale prices because her place is far from the market.

Susan would like to buy more vegetables, meat and ingredients needed for her food stall business. However, she suffers from a shortage of funds. In this regard, she is requesting a loan amounting to P7,000. She hopes to make her business grow and be profitable, so she can renovate her food stall to make it more attractive to customers.

loans.use: to buy  vegetables, meat and ingredients needed for her food stall business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 40 years old and married. She has 3 children. Remedios has had a sari-sari store business for 4 years. She sells various items such as spices, soft drinks, and purified water. Each month, Remedios earns 5000 PHP from her business.

Remedios has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and softdrinks. Remedios hopes that through her business, her children will be able to finish school and their living situation will improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices, and softdrinks

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 31 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 10 years old. He has owned a small boutique (store) selling body lotion, biscuits, breads, juice etc. for the past of 5 years. His business is well-organized and he works from 6am until 6pm every day, except Saturdays.

Leonard has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via the Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing breads, juice, cooking oil and others. He plans to reinvest the profit in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more breads, juice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is married and has three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Pulang Yuta. Gina is in agricultural business. She operated a specialized coconut farm to earn a living and she had in this business for 10 years. Every month, she earns Php 8, 345.00 doing this kind of business. Gina is request Php 30,000 to purchase fertilizers for her coconut farm and for the maintenance of her farm. She was able to help her neighbor because she paid them in cleaning her coconut farm. Gina striving herself to make her business successful for the future of her family and she plans to buy even a one hectare coconut farm with the help of Gata Daku.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

location.town: Pulang yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en: Mayada is a 26-year-old young woman. She is divorced and has one son and one daughter. She has a sheep-raising project and benefits from its products by selling them. Also, she has another source of income from agriculture. Mayada wants to expand her project by purchasing more sheep and fodder. However, the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for this, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Mayada gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more sheep and fodder. She will be able to expand the project, and the productivity of the project will increase. This will result in increased sales, which will lead to an increased income and better living conditions for her family. Mayada is a conservative woman, so her father was photographed instead of her in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert used the previous loan to cultivate land. He planted maize and beans, resulting in a high yield. He decided to start up a food store dealing in the sale of cereals. The business has been profitable despite challenges in price fluctuations and an unsustainable supply from other farmers. He intends to use the loan to cultivate land in preparation for the next season.

loans.use: to cultivate land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire digital satellite television equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and one cow.

loans.name: Kabanyana

texts.en:
Kabanyana is 32 years old and single. She has been selling green bananas, cooking oil and juice for about five years. Her business hours are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Kabanyana has requested this loan through Kiva's partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more cooking oil and juice to sell. The extra income generated from the loan will help her to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase green bananas, cooking oil, juice for resale.

loans.name: Framierie

texts.en:
Framierie is married with three children. She is 41 years old and lives in Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga del Sur.

Framiere runs a sari sari (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase stock and add to her capital.

Framierie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Framierie hopes to help her family and provide for their daily needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en: Five years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Asel started to sell grocery goods. Asel is 37 and married to a construction worker. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons and a daughter who are studying at school. She earns about 4,000 soms per month. Her profit made it possible to increase commodity turnover and to purchase a fridge to improve their living conditions. With money from this loan, Asel wants to purchase 100 kg of sugar, oil and detergents. In the future she wishes to expand the store. Asel is the treasurer of this group. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kg of sugar, oil and detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Twitezimbere (Gkn) Group

texts.fr:
Félicien fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere. Le nom du groupe signifie « se développer entre nous même ». Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 4 à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Félicien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique pour améliorer la qualité du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Félicien voudrait être le distributeur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Félicien is a member of Twitezimbere Group, which means "developing ourselves one another". He is 40 years old, married and the father of six children, aged 4 to 16, with four of them attending school. He attended secondary school until third grade.

Félicien is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with the microfinance institution ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

His growth strategy for his business consists in using chemical fertilizer to improve the quality of his rice crop. In the years to come Félicien would like to become a known rice supplier in his region. He intends to use his profit to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шамсидин честный предприниматель. Он начал заниматься предпринимательством куплей и продажей мелких товаров. Более 5 лет Шамсидин  занимается куплей и продажей продуктов питания и строительных материалов. Продукты он приобретает в неделю 1-2 раза  на центральном рынке на сумму 2000- 2500$ США. Его  торговая точка находится на самом многолюдном месте. Шамсидин женат, и у них 5 детей. Старший ребенок помогает ему в бизнесе. Шамсидину  для расширения бизнеса нужны новые товары, а для этого нужны средства. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000$ США. Он надеется, что вы не откажете ему в поддержке и благодарит вас за помощь.
texts.en: Shamsidin is an honest entrepreneur. He started his business activity by buying and reselling miscellaneous wares. For about five years , Shamsidin has been working as a vendor of food items and construction materials. He buys food items once or twice a week at the Central market, for about  2,000-2,500 USD. His stand is in a place that gets very high customer traffic. Shamsidin is married, and he and his wife have five children. His eldest child helps out in the business. Shamsidin needs new stock of goods to expand his business, and this requires financial means. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 USD. He hopes that you will not deny him your support and thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy food and construction materials for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter wants a loan to buy the local brew for resale. Aged 42 years, he hails from the Kyenjojo District in Uganda. He is a father of four children whom he lives with together with their mother in a semi-permanent house. Having started by distilling alcohol by himself, he saved money and he now buys from others -- a business that has grown over 21 years. His dream is to build a permanent house and increase his sources of income by venturing into the cattle trade.

loans.use: to buy the local brew for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three calves

loans.name: Edwin
