texts.en:
Edwin is 40 years old and married. His wife is Viola. They support a family of six people. He runs an agro-vet shop  which he has been operating for a period of three years.

Edwin has applied for a loan of Kshs.20,000 which he will use to purchase additional drugs and feeds for his agro-vet business.He earns an income of Kshs.15000 per month. The anticipated profit will be used to expand the business.

This is Edwin's first loan from KADET LTD.He hopes to stabilize his business, improve the living standard of the family and also improve the eduction level of his children .

loans.use: to purchase drugs and feeds for his agro-vet shop

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline is 44 years old and not married. She supports a family of five people.She has applied for a loan  of Kshs.25000 which she will use to buy stock of clothes for sale.

Maryline has been running her boutique shop for a period of three years.She earns an income of Kshs.13000 per month. The anticipated profit she will use to buy  more stock for her business.

This is Maryline's fourth loan from KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to build rental houses and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a mortorbike to transport the weaving products to sell

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien, 23, is single. He takes care of two relatives, ages 11 and 14. Fabien is a self-employed businessman selling tableware such dishes, glasses, trays etc.. His shop is open from 6am until 5:30pm daily and he employees two people to help him. 

Fabien has requested a loan through Vision Finance in order to expand his shop by purchasing new tableware. With this loan he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, he hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to renovate his house, continue paying school fees for his two relatives and to build a secure future.

loans.use: To purchase more tableware for sale

loans.name: Tania P.

texts.fr: Mariée, Tania vit avec ses 5 enfants dans sa maison familiale. Les enfants sont tous scolarisés. Tania a pour activité la vente de divers articles tels que les produits alimentaires, les boissons, les glacières et autres articles au marché Fifadji, un des marchés de la ville de Cotonou. Ses clients ont constitués des usagers du marché et de ses environs. Elle fait ses achats dans les marchés de Cotonou. Tania  a décidé de renouveler son 8ème crédit à FINADEV pour achalander sa boutique de divers articles afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par le micro crédit lui permettra d'aider son mari au foyer.
texts.en:
Tatiana is married and lives with her five children in her family home. All children have attended school. Tatiana sells various items such as foodstuffs, beverages, coolers, etc. at the Fifadji market, in the city of Cotonou. Her customer base consists of market-goers and local shoppers. She buys her stock in the Cotonou markets. 

Tatiana has renewed her eighth loan with FINADEV. She will stock up on merchandise for her shop in order to better meet customer demand. The extra revenue earned through this credit will allow her to help her husband with the household responsibilities.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, 28 years old, is tailor who earns $6 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns $4 per day. They have two children, and both of them are studying in school. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $20 on electricity, $40 on school fees, and $15 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fabric to make clothes to sell. This loan can help her to continue her career and even make more income because she can buy more fabric to make clothes to sell. She plans to open a tailoring shop when she can make a good profit and can have more customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory like sugar, salt, and soft drinks for sale in his store

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
This is Pinky, 28, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Edy, a technician. They have one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Pinky operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. She sells footwear, like sandals and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Aside from this, she sells cooked viands (savory dishes) for added income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She makes a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of sandals, slippers, and other footwear to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  

Pinky dreams to have a bigger store in the future and hopes to give her child a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional inventory of footwear items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 34-year-old married man with three children. He has a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Roberto has been running his store for eight years. He sells canned goods, shampoo and sachets of coffee and milk. Roberto also sells rice to the people in his community.

Roberto requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice and sugar. Roberto hopes to expand his store in the future. He also wishes for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mekhrob

texts.ru: Мехроб является отцом троих детей и для обеспечения своей семьи  занимается перевозкой песка и камней на собственной машине. Ранее он работал водителем в колхозе имени Р.Назирова. Решил заниматься предпринимательством и открыл свое дело по предоставлению услуг по перевозке стройматериалов- песка и камней. Мехроб хочет получить займ для установки газового оборудования на автомашине так, как расходы по ГСМ- бензину слишком дороги.
texts.en: Mekhrob is a father of three children and is involved in transporting sand and stones in his own vehicle in order to provide for his family.  Previously, he worked as a driver at a collective farm, named in honor of R. Nazirov.  Mekhrob decided to become an entrepreneur and opened his own business of providing transportation services of construction materials, such as sand and stones.  He wants to obtain a loan to install gas equipment for his vehicle because the expenses for petrol fuel are too high.

loans.use: to install gas equipment

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin is a grocery seller and also fattens pigs for sale, earning $5 per day. Her husband is working for the government earning $3 per day. This couple does not have any children yet. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $15 on electricity, and $35 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $900 to buy groceries for sale. Before, she worked as a waitress in a restaurant but now she sells groceries and feeds pigs at home. She plans to buy more pigs to feed when she can make a good profit from the pig sales.

loans.use: To buy groceries for sale

loans.name: Hermione

texts.fr: Hermione vit en location avec son mari et ses 3 enfants, tous scolarisés. Les dépenses du foyer reviennent à son mari mais elle y participe aussi. Hermione vend des produits cosmétiques, des mèches, des produits alimentaires et des boissons. En cette période  de la rentrée scolaire, elle y a associé la vente des fournitures scolaires. Ses clients sont constitués des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnements dans les marchés du Bénin. Hermione souhaiterait une augmentation de son fonds de commerce afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, raison pour laquelle elle a sollicité et obtenu son 8ème renouvellement de micro crédit à FINADEV. L'intérêt généré par le micro crédit lui permettra de faire face à ses charges personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Hermione lives with her husband and her three children who are all in school.  Her household expenses fall to her husband but she also helps out.  Hermione sells cosmetics, candles, food and drinks.  During this back-to-school period she sells school supplies. Her customers are residents of her area and surrounding areas.  She buys her products in the markets in Benin.  Hermione would like to increase her business capital in order to better satisfy her customers.  For this reason, she has requested her eighth loan from FINADEV.  The profits she makes from her micro loan will allow her to cover her personal and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy thirty boxes of exercise books and twenty boxes of biros

loans.name: Djromahuton 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON 5 est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et vendent leur produits dans le même marché au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Eugénie Ayodélé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eugénie Ayodélé est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Eugénie Ayodélé est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Léon. Le couple à un enfant scolarisé et encore à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Eugénie Ayodélé et son mari. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Eugénie Ayodélé prépare de la bouillie de maïs et du mil qu'elle vend à son domicile. A côté de cette activité,Eugénie Ayodélé vend des bijoux au Bénin. Eugénie Ayodélé s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Eugénie Ayodélé sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON 5, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Group Djromahuton 5 is composed of four people who reside in the same district and sell their products at the same market in Benin. This is the second time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to raise their activity level. The group's representative, named Eugénie Ayodélé, is raising her hand on the picture.
Eugénie Ayodélé is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a school teacher named Léon. The couple has one child, still in their care, who attends school. Eugénie Ayodélé and her husband provide for the family's various needs. In order to support herself and her child, Eugénie Ayodélé cooks corn porridge and millet which she sells from home. In addition to this business, Eugénie Ayodélé sells jewelry in Benin. She gets her supplies from a town in Benin.
To increase customer satisfaction, her sales and her profit, Eugénie Ayodélé is requesting a second loan together with the other members of group Djromahuton 5.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, millet), wheat flour and cassava.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat was born in 1987. She lives in the Reussey Keo community with her humble husband and only one favorite kid. Presently, she is a clothes seller in front of her house, where she is able to earn about $4 for each day. She is married to Mr. Sali, who is a craftsman. He has been running this type of industry since 2008. 

For promoting her family to live in a better quality of life, Mrs. Phat and her husband wish to borrow some funds through HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, with the purpose of purchasing additional craft materials. She is expecting that this loan will make her family meet happiness, prosperity and gain more benefits daily. This is her first loan with HKL and Kiva. She is very thankful to all kind lenders who assist her family in avoiding the poverty line.

loans.use: to purchase additional craft materials.

loans.name: Putheavy

texts.en: Putheavy, 39 years old, is a motor taxi driver who earns $3 per day. His wife is a grocery seller earning $4 per day. They have two children, one is studying and one is too small to go to school. Every month, Putheavy has to spend $99 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a car for traveling to visit his plantation which is far from home. He also wants to boost his wife's career by buying more groceries to sell. He hopes to have enough money to support his children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a car for traveling to visit his plantation

loans.name: Agossi Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Agossi est une femme  âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 01 enfant en charge.
Agossi travaille comme revendeuse de jus (citron, orange) depuis 2006. Elle répond à la demande de ses clients dans un quartier de Lomé et achète les intrants à Lomé.
Agossi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des intrants (sucre, orange, citrons…).
texts.en:
Agossi is 35 years old and married to a driver. She has one child in her care. She has been selling lemon and orange juice since 2006. Her business is located in a neighborhood of Lomé where she serves her customers. She buys the ingredients for her juices in Lomé.

Agossi came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy ingredients (sugar, oranges, lemons, ...).

loans.use: to buy juice ingredients (sugar, oranges and lemons).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase one cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Mahdya

texts.en:
Mahdya is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and two daughters; her husband is employed in a center with a decent salary. 

Mahdya has a project of making packaged food for sale such as cheese, dairy products, olives, etc. She wants to purchase more bottles and wrapping materials to increase her production, but she hasn't enough money , so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When she gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase bottles and wrapping materials that she needs to increase her production and increase her sales. This will improve her income and enable her to live in better conditions with her family. Mayada is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase bottles and wrapping materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao, 44 years old, is a guard in a hotel and earns $4.50 per day. His wife is a farmer who earns $3 per day. They have seven children; four are studying, another two are working and earn $5 per day together, and one more is only 3 years old. Every month, he has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. He wants to help his wife to have a small grocery shop to sell from after she finishes doing farming so that she can make other income. For his children, he will support them to study English so that they will easily find a job to do.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 33 years old and married with three children, between the aged 3 and 8 years old. He sells shoes in the market. He has been in this business for two years and works from 6 a.m until 6 p.m every day of the week.

Celestin has requested a loan from Kiva lenders from Vision Finance Company in order to support his business through the purchasing of more shoes to sell. With this profit, Celestin will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Mahudekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDEKON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin.C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Célestine est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Célestine est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Gbènangnon.Le couple à trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge.Célestine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Célestine mène comme activité la vente des bijoux et du pâté à son domicile et de façon ambulante. A côté de cette activité Célestine vend des fournitures scolaires.Célestine mène cette activité il y a une dizaine d'année. Célestine s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDEKON un deuxième crédit.Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The MAHUDEKON group has three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time the group has requested a loan from ALIDE in order to improve their businesses. The group leader, whose name is Célestine has her hand raised in the photo. Célestine is 33 years old and lives in Benin. Célestine is married to a carpenter named, Gbènangnon. The couple has three children which are still in their care and attend school. Célestine didn't complete much schooling. In order to properly care for her children, Célestine manages her business of selling pâté from her house and by going door to door. As a side business, she also sells school supplies. Célestine has been in business for about 10 years. Célestine buys her products at a market in Benin. In an effort to better satisfy her clients and increase sales, Célestine is requesting along with the other members of MAHUDEKON, a second round of financing. The first loan was properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and wheat flour

loans.name: Mavchudakhon

texts.ru: Мавчудахон является матерью пятерых детей. Муж работает электриком. Для содержания и оказанию помощи мужу в содержании детей 18 лет она занимается торговлей ковровой продукции. Получение займа ей даст возможность расширить ассортимент и приобрести больше товаров. Для этого она запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони.
texts.en: Mavchudakhon is a mother of five children.  Her husband works as an electrician.  In order to support and help her husband provide for the children, Mavchudakhon has been involved in sales of rugs for 18 years.  Obtaining this loan will give her an opportunity to expand her merchandise assortment and buy more merchandise.  Mavchudakhon is requesting a loan in the sum of 2000 Somoni for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Porn, 41 years old, is a worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is also a worker and earns $4 per day. They have three children and all of them are studying in school. Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, $15 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She wants to feed pigs at home so that she can make other profit to support her family. She also wants to build a new house because her house now is not in good condition to stay in.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
This is Lily, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Victor, a sea man, and the mother to their three children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lily operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells the items for a little profit. Her products are children’s clothes, RTW and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lily hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tezimberigihugu Group

texts.fr:
Jonas  fait partie du groupe Tezimberigihugu. Le nom du groupe signifie « développer le pays». Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 12 enfants de 7 à 28 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  7 ans de primaire.

Jonas est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimique. Dans les prochaines années, Jonas voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz et être le fournisseur de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jonas belongs to the Tezimberigihugu group. The group's name means "development for the country." Jonas is 45 years old and married with 12 children ranging from 7 to 28 years old, of whom 4 have received schooling. Jonas was educated for 7 years of elementary school.

Jonas grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB, and he will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizers for rice. His strategy for business growth is to use choice seeds and chemical fertilizers. Over the next few years, Jonas would like to grow rice over a bigger area and would like to be a rice supplier. With the profits he plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Aboudou Rachidi

texts.fr:
Aboudou est  un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants. 
Aboudou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Il sert ses clients dans un quartier de la place et est aidé par 03 personnes. 
Aboudou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pneus. 
Dans les prochaines années, Aboudou voudrait ajouter d’autres activités à la première.
texts.en:
Aboudou Is a 33-year-old man. He is married to a retailer. He has two children.

He has been working as a retailer since 2001. He serves his customers in a neighborhood of the area and has three persons helping him.

Aboudou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy more tires. In the next few years, he would like to add another activity to the first one.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sori, 45-years-old, is a grocery seller and earns $10 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns $10 per day. They have six children, four are studying and two more are working and they earn $15 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $198 on food, $25 on electricity, and $70 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy grocery goods to sell in her shop. 

This loan will help her to get more customers because before her house didn’t have enough goods to serve the customers and now she has more things to sell. She wants to buy a small shop in the market for her daughter to sell grocery goods when she has enough money.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est composé de trois membres qui vivent dans le même quartier et font la tontine ensemble. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Marie est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une cinquième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Marie est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à Sourou, un dépanneur. Le couple a cinq enfants dont un reste encore à leur charge. Marie n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Marie mène comme activité la vente des noix de palme.A côté de cette activité,Marie vend du vin de palme. Marie exerce ces activités depuis près de quarante ans. Marie  s'approvisionne en noix et en vin de palme dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Marie et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The JESUKPEGO group has three members that live in the same neighborhood and save in the same tontine. The group's representative, Marie has her hand raised in the photo. To increase sales and to better serve their clients, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDE for the 5th time. Marie is 51 years old and married to Sourou, a repairman. The couple takes care of their five children. Marie never attended school. In order to satisfy her various needs, she sells palm nuts. As a side business, she also sells palm wine. She has been in business for almost 40 years. Marie purchases her nuts and wine in a city of Benin. In an effort to strengthen her business and better server her clients, Marie and the other members of JESUKPEGO are requesting a loan from ALIDE. Their goal is to grow the business.  Their past loans have all been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and palm wine.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is married and her husband is an employee in a private company. His earnings are insufficient for the whole family and that’s why Sughran started clothes sewing business few years ago. She is very skillful and receives good number of orders every month. She has another business which is selling rice. She purchases rice from different cities and sells to her community customers and grocery stores for profit. 

She is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her sons are college students while her daughter is studying in class 7th. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her rice selling business. She will invest the loan money in purchasing rice in a bulk quantity that will allow her to offer good quality rice to her customers which will increase her sales and profits. 

She is very much experienced in her business and has been operating it for past 9 years. She is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and help her family to live a better financial life. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sughran".

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, 42-years-old, is an animal seller. She feed pigs to sell and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a general doctor and earns $10 per day. They have three children, two are studying and the third child is only 1-year-old. Every month, she has to spend $38 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $25 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy more pigs to feed and sell. She wants to buy more pigs to sell so she can make a good profit and have enough money for her children. She will support them to study in the university.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est composé de trois membres qui vivent dans le même quartier et fréquentent la même église. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Marie Kottin, est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une cinquième fois,l'appui financier de ALIDé. Marie Kottin est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain Idelphonse. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés,dont un reste encore à leur charge. Marie Kottin n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Marie Kottin mène comme activité depuis trente cinq  ans environs, la vente du charbon de bois à son domicile.A côté de cette activité, Marie Kottin  vend du vin de palme.C'est dans l'une des villes du Bénin, que Marie Kottin s'approvisionne en charbon de bois.Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle,Marie Kottin et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUTIN has three members who live in the same neighborhood and attend the same church. The representative for the group, Marie Kottin has her hand raised in the photo. To increase sales and to better serve their clients, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDE for the 5th time. Marie Kottin is 58 years old and married to Idelphonse. The couple has four children who attend school, so are naturally still in their care. Marie Kottin never attended school. In order to satisfy her needs and those of her children, Marie Kottin has been selling wood charcoal from her home for about the past 35 years. As a side business, she also sells palm wine. Marie purchases her charcoal from a city in Benin. In an effort to strengthen her business and better serve her clients, Marie and the other members of JESUKPEGO are requesting their 5th loan from ALIDE. Their goal is to grow the business. Their past loans have all been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Tursunoi

texts.ru: Турсуной на протяжении шести лет занимается предпринимательством. Замужем, является матерью троих детей. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Для содержания и для обеспечения детей она занимается торговлей женской одежды. Она желает получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса и увеличения ассортимента товаров.
texts.en: Tursunoi has been involved in an entrepreneurship for six years.  She is married and is a mother of three children.  Her husband is working in Russia.  Tursunoi is involved in sales of women's clothing in order to support and provide for her children.  She wishes to obtain a loan to expand her business and the assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Suos is hard working at the construction field. He has been working as a construction worker for long time in the Kompong Chhnang province. From his business, he typically earns an average of $2.5USD per day to cover the family’s needs. Suos is married with three single children who live under his care. 

Due to the lack of construction materials, Suos faces difficulties in his work. Therefore, he would like to request a loan from Kiva and HKL to purchase construction supplies in the sum of KHR 800,000. With the increase in income, Mr. Suos hopes to provide his children opportunities to be educated in a university.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Erkhembaatar

texts.en:
Erkhembaatar is 25 years old. He lives with his mother, sisters, and brothers in a small house they recently purchased. Because of unhealthy working conditions, he had left his job last year. With his savings, he bought a car in order to run a taxi business. He works hard to support his family (his mother is retired and his five brothers and sisters do not work). His house has became very old and uncomfortable to live in. Therefore he has started to repair his house recently. 

But due to a lack of money, he has been unable to finish the repair and adjustments. Enkhbaatar is asking for a loan to purchase building materials in order to finish the repair of the house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials in order to finish repairing his house.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is 29 years old and is married with three children who are between two and six years old. Vianney is known in the business of selling shoes, mainly men's shoes. He has been in this business for about one year and his business is open from 7 am until 6 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. 

Vianney has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to expand his business by buying more new shoes to sell. With this loan, he has a vision of wholesaling and retailing at the same time so that he can increase his revenue. If successful, Vianney hopes to continue building a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more new shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.en:
Ambrocio is 39 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Three of his children are in high school together. Ambrocio's wife is a housekeeper, at the same time managing a small business in their village. Ambrocio engages in farming, planting rice in their village. 

To make extra income, Ambrocio has a hog raising business. He has been in this business for 20 years. Because of the increasing price of pig feed, Ambrocio needs additional working capital to maintain his business. He is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. 

In the future, Ambrocio wishes for the growth of his business. His goal is to gain more income in preparation for sending his children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Fifamé Lydia N.

texts.fr: Fifamé Lydia est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Fifamé Lydia est mariée à un photographe du nom de Hervé. Le couple à quatre enfants à charge dont trois sont les leurs.Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Fifamé Lydia n'a jamais été à l’école, mais a appris le métier de photographie.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Fifamé Lydia  exerce le métier de photographie depuis près de trois ans.A côté de cette activité,Fifamé Lydia vend des sucreries. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité,Fifamé Lydia contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille.Fifamé Lydia s’approvisionne en articles de photographie au Nigéria Etat voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Fifamé Lydia sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Fifamé Lydia is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a photographer called Hervé. The couple are raising 4 children, 3 of whom are their own. Some of the children go to school. Fifamé Lydia has no formal education, but has taught herself photography and has been earning a living for herself and her children as a photographer for nearly 3 years. She also sells sweets. Her combined incomes enable her to contribute to the household expenses.

Fifamé Lydia gets her photographic supplies in Nigeria, a neighbouring country. She is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé in order to invest in her business so that she can satisfy her customers, increase her revenues and increase her standard of living. She has fully repaid all previous loans.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some DVDs.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 52 years old and married to Benson, who is a businessman. They are blessed with five children. She owns a quarry in the area of Lukenya where most of her clients are women. She has been this business for the last five years and gets an income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a client of KADET. She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET Ltd. with which she plans to purchase another quarry. 

She will use the anticipated profit to purchase a plot at Kalusya in Lukenya and build rentals. Teresia hopes to own a lorry for transporting out stones from the quarry. She is very focused and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase another quarry.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 55, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mario, a maintenance staff worker, and mother to four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Erlinda operates a retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory products and items from wholesalers, then sell them per item at a profit. Her products are hair clips, ribbons, head bands, and the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 17,000  PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of accessory products and items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erlinda hopes to have a bigger store and dreams to be able to give her children a good education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of accessory items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adandédjan

texts.fr: Adandédjan est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Adandédjan est marié à une marchande du nom de Marie. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge dont quatre sont les leurs. Certains des enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Adandédjan  mène comme activité la transformation des noix de palme en l’huile de palme.A côté de cette activité Adandédjan a appris le métier de maçonnerie. Adandédjan exerce  cette activité passionnément depuis quatre ans. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité Adandédjan contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Adandédjan sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adandédjan s’approvisionne en noix de palme au Bénin. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Adandédjan ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Adandédjan is 40 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant named Marie. The couple has five dependent children, four of whom are their own. Not all children attend school. The whole family lives together. The couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

To support himself and his family, Adandédjan runs a business turning palm nuts into palm oil. As a sideline he also learned the trade of masonry, and has been practicing this profession with a great passion for four years. With the income that he earns, Adandédjan is able to provide for his family’s needs. 

In order to meet the needs of a growing customer base, Adandédjan is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. He buys his stock of palm nuts in Benin. All previous credits granted to Adandédjan were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts for processing into palm oil

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 31 years old. He is married to Ann and together they have two children. He sells sandals. He has been in the business for the past 12 years. He gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase sandals to add more stock for his business. 

He will use anticipated profits to educate his children. He hopes to have a stable business and to open an enclosed stall.

loans.use: to purchase sandals.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор мать двоих детей, разведенная. Она для обеспечения своей семьи занимается торговлей промтоварами. Восемь лет она занимается торговлей тканей. Для расширения ассортимента своего товара она хочет получить займ. Также  полученный займ поможет приобрести ассортимент осенних и зимних  тканей .
texts.en: Zulkhumor is a divorced mother of two children.  She is involved in selling household products in order to provide for her family.  She has been selling fabrics for eight years.  Zulkhumor wants to obtain this loan in order to expand the assortment of her merchandise.  This loan would also help her buy an assortment of autumn and winter fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 34 years old and he is married with four children between the ages of 6 and 12 years old. Innocent makes a living by selling clothes and shoes. This is his 10th successful year in this business. Innocent's business is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

After realizing that his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Innocent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. With this loan, Innocent will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tammana's Group

texts.en:
Tammana is a 44-year-old married lady. Her husband operates a motor workshop. He is very skillful at his work. People trust his services and appreciate him for his good work. 

Tammana is also very skillful, sewing clothes for her neighbors on order. She charges 150 Pakistani rupees for each job and, due to her good quality work, she receives a good number of orders every month. Tammana has given birth to four daughters and a son. She has enrolled all of them in school and she pays for their education expenses from her earnings. 

Tammana has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband, who wants to buy some repairing tools and spare parts for his business. This will help him provide better quality repairing services to his customers and increase his profits. Tammana is very confident that her husband will be able to get positive financial results from his business after the investment. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tammana.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for a motor workshop

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Enkhjargal is 28 years old and divorced. She lives with her son in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent, on her brother’s owned land. She sells shoes in the bazaar. She has been running this business for one year. She and her son used to live in her relative’s house before. She is a very hardworking and independent woman who is diligent about making her life better. She is requesting a loan to cover the fee of renting one more bulk container to expand her business. It is very important to raise her earnings in the future.

loans.use: To cover the fee of renting one more bulk container to expand her business.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. Ou is a 62-year-old humble villager who currently lives with her two daughters in Kampong Chhnang province. She was married but she was divorced with her husband. Mrs. Ou earns a living by providing cleaning services to a local hospital. She can earn around $2 USD each day. One of her daughters is married and the other works as a garment factory worker. Her daughter's workplace is far away from the province, so every day she gets to work by hiring a motor taxi service. The transportation fees are related to her living condition. Mrs. Ou has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to use to travel to work. This loan will improve her standard of living. She is grateful to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 31 years old and married with four children, who are three and 10 years old. He sells shoes in the market. He has been in this business for 10 years and works from 6 am until 6 pm every day of the week. Jean Baptiste employees three people to help him.  

Jean Baptiste has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With this profit, Jean Baptiste will save for his children and build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sohoueto De Womey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SOHOUETO DE WOMEY est composé de vingt trois personnes qui sont toutes membre d'un ancien groupement et habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Thomasia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Thomasia est âgée de 53 ans et vit au Bénin.Thomasia est marié à un agent de police du nom de Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à leur charge.  Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Thomasia et son mari.Thomasia a fréquenté l'école jusqu'à l'université. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Thomasia vend des boissons non alcoolisées. A côté de cette activité,Thomasia est la gérante d'une buvette. Thomasia s’approvisionne en boissons au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Thomasia sollicite  ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO DE WOMEY,un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The Sohoueto de Womey group is composed of 23 persons who are all members of a previous group and live in the same area of Benin.
This is the first time this group is requesting financial help from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity.

The leader of the group named Thomasia has her hand raised on the photo. She is 53 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to policeman named Antoine. The couple has three children; all attended school and two of them are still under their care. Thomasia and her husband  cover the various household expenses. Thomasia attended school up to University. To provide for her needs and those of her children she sells non-alcoholic beverages. In parallel to this activity she also manages a refreshment stand. She gets her supplies in Benin.

With her goal of meeting her customers’ demand and to increase her sales and income, Thomasia, along with the other members of the Sohoueto de Womey group, is requesting a first loan.

loans.use: to purchase non-alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is aged 43 and has been in farming for over 10 years in his local home area in Litein in the South Rift of Kenya. He produces tea, milk and broilers for the local market.

Richards has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to buy poultry, both layers and broilers (birds for eggs and for meat respectively) . He says he wants to expand his poultry farming so that he can fully rely on it to cover the family needs, especially the education of his children. He is very optimistic the businesses will continue to improve.

However, he mentions the high cost of animal feeds as a great challenge.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 28 years old and married with one child who is two years old. Jackson makes a living by sewing clothes to sell. This is his10th successful year in this business. Jackson's business is open from 6 am until 7pm every day and employees three people.

Jackson has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sew. With this loan, Jackson will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sew

loans.name: Abdulia  Karim

texts.en:
Abdulia is 43 years old and married with six children between the age of one and 17. He runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Abdulia has been in this business for 14 years and sells drinks, cigarettes; milk and mosquito spray at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is a problem with thieves.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks, cigarettes, milk and mosquito spray. Abdulai says that the extra income from this loan will help him to render assistance to his family. In the future, he would like to be a supplier to other partners.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, cigarettes, milk and mosquito spray.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is separated and has been blessed with two children. She is currently spending her income on her two students. Yolanda continues to make her grocery store grow. For almost 15 years of operating this business, she has been able to increase the income generated. Thanks to her willingness and effort, she has been able to achieve a stable business. Yolanda tries to keep her customers satisfied by offering a variety of products.

With her previous loan, Yolanda bought products for her store with the intent of increasing her income each day. Being a single mom, she needs to double her effort and time to be able to sustain all the needs of her family. In this way, she can support her children until they will finish their degree course. Yolanda would like to fulfill her dreams in life, so for these reasons, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000, which will be use in restocking her grocery store. She believes that she can increase her sales, have more variety and fulfill her obligations to her two children.

loans.use: to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose describes himself as god-fearing. He is a loving father of three school-aged children. Jose and his wife are working together to improve their living. His wife cooks and sells snack foods nearby in the school in their village. Jose is good at wood carving and runs a furniture making business in their village. Jose and his wife's priority is to prepare for their children’s education; they will enter college in the next school year. To gain extra income, Jose engages in a pig raising business. He has been doing this business for 11 years and uses his income to improve their house. Jose wishes to maintain the business. He is requesting a loan of P35,000 to buy feed for his pigs to grow. The loan will make a good contribution to maintaining his business and uplifting their family living standards.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Sohoueto De Womey 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOHOUETO DE WOMEY 2 est composé de dix huit personnes qui sont toute membre d'un ancien groupement et habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Antoinette Lydie est celle qui à la main levée sur la photo. Antoinette Lydie est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Philippe. Le couple à quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Antoinette Lydie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Antoinette Lydie mène comme activité la vente des chaussures. A côté de cette activité, Antoinette Lydie prépare de la nourriture( pâte de riz préparée à vapeur)qu'elle vend au Bénin.Antoinette Lydie mène cette activité il y a deux ans environ. Antoinette Lydie s’approvisionne en chaussure et en riz dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Antoinette Lydie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO DE WOMEY 2,un premier crédit.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO DE WOMEY 2 Group is made up of eighteen persons, who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. They were all members of a previous group.

The group's representative, named Antoinette Lydie, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 40 years old and married to a welder named Philippe.

The couple has four school-attending children they still have to support. The children live together with their parents. Antoinette Lydie didn't attend school much.

To provide for herself and her children, she sells shoes. Besides, for about two years, she's been preparing food (steam-cooked rice pasta) and selling it in Benin.

Antoinette Lydie gets her rice supplies from one of Benin's markets. Eager to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking her first loan, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy shoes and rice

loans.name: Makhpirat

texts.ru: Махпиратхон замужем является матерью троих детей. Для содержания  своей семьи в продолжении восьми лет занимается предпринимательством продажей женских одежд. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса и увеличения ассортимента своего товара. Она заранее благодарить всех кредиторов за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Makhpirat is married and is a mother of three children.  To support her family, she has been involved in an entrepreneurship of selling women's clothing for eight years.  She wants to obtain this loan to expand her business and the assortment of her merchandise.  Makhpirat thanks all creditors in advance for their help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
To generate income, Benito is engaged in cooking and selling different snacks in the market. He is now 61 years old and has only one child. He aims to improve their status of living to give his family a better life. Despite hardships and problems he has encountered in life, he still has the strong determination to achieve his goal someday. 

He aims to improve the business and increase his income to satisfy their needs and save for their future but due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of P50,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy spaghetti, cheese, flour, sugar, milk, coconut, cream and seasonings to cook and sell snacks in the market. He mentioned that through this loan, he can improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future. He believes that through patience and hard work, he can make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti, cheese, flour, sugar, milk, coconut, cream and seasonings to cook and sell snacks in the market

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 42 years old, married with seven children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. He has been in his business for three years. It is open every day of the week from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. He has six employees.

Innocent will use this loan to purchase new material for his tap. He would like to save up his profits and open another business selling salt, soap, cooking oil and so on.

loans.use: To buy new material for his tap.

loans.name: Wanjohi

texts.en:
Wanjohi is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He is 38 years old and married with four children between one and ten years-old. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables for the local market. He fully relies on farming for his family upkeep.

Wanjohi has made a loan request amounting to 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He will use the additional income to repay the loan and school fees for his children. He hopes to upgrade his cattle in future and operate under economies of scale.

He mentions high costs of raising animals as the main problem in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат замужем, мать двоих детей Муж является колхозником. На рынке она торгует фруктами и овощами, продукцией сельского хозяйства. Полученный займ она хочет использовать для ежедневного приобретения свежей сельхоз продукции и её перепродажи на рынке. Она заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу доброту и помощь. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Nazokat is married and is a mother of two children.  Her husband is a farm worker.  Nazokat sells fruits and vegetables, agricultural crops at the market.  She wants to use the obtained loan for the daily purchases and resale of agricultural products at the market.  She thanks all of you in advance for your kindness and help.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Faina

texts.en:
Faina is 27 years old and is single. Faina owns a shop selling clothes. This is her fifth successful year in this business. The hours of her shop are 7 a.m to 6 p.m everyday. 

Faina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her working capital. This will allow her to purchase more clothes. With the profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abadahemukamumihigo / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Lazare fait partie du groupe Abadahemukamumihigo. Le nom du groupe signifie «faithful in performance ». Il a 51 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 10 à 25 ans, dont 8 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Lazare est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionnée du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Lazare voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour la culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Lazare is part of the Abadahemukamumihigo group.  The group's name means "faithful in performance".  He is 51 years old and married, with eight children between the ages of 10 and 25, all eight of which have attended or are attending school.  His own education level is six years of primary school.

Lazare grows rice.  This is his second loan through ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming.  His strategy to grow his business is to use selected rice seed.  In the next few years, Lazare would like to buy more land for rice cultivation.  With the profits, he plans to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming.

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is 51 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are still in school. She is a farmer in her native home in Kitale, Western Kenya, producing and selling milk, eggs and vegetables to the local market.  She relies on farming for her family needs.

Unice has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partners Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry.  This boost in her business will provide for better living standards for her family. She says there is high demand for poultry birds and eggs and is optimistic that the returns will be great.

Unice is glad that Juhudi Kilimo is promising to pay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.ru: Руслан является собственником современного бизнеса по ремонту мобильных сотовых трубок. Он отец двоих детей. Женат. Жена является домохозяйкой. Получение займа даст Руслану возможность приобрести запчасти для мобильных трубок разных марок что повлечет за собой развитие бизнеса а также приобретения новых сотовых трубок и получение хороших доходов.
texts.en: Ruslan is a modern business owner specializing in mobile phone repair. He is a father of two children and married. His wife is a homemaker. This loan will provide Ruslan with an opportunity to buy spare parts for mobile devices of different brands which will be followed by with business growth and also purchase of new mobile phones and getting additional profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for mobile phones.

loans.name: Slyvere

texts.en:
Slyvere is 32 years old and is single. He sells charcoal in his market. He has been in this business for three years and works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. everyday of the week.

Slyvere has requested a loan from Kiva through Vision Finance Company in order to support his business by purchasing of more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the profits, Slyvere will buy the food for his family and save money.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
Lope is hard working father of four. He is 56 years old and is married. Lope is involved in the agricultural businesses of rice farming and hog raising. Lope’s wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing the business to gain higher income and further bestow the needs of his family.

Lope is having difficulties providing feed for his hogs. As such, he has decided to request a loan amounting to P30,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs. He hopes to maintain and continue the operations of his business as an additional source of income of the family. Lope believes that the loan will have a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Abie is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 13. She runs a local food stuff store in Waterloo near Freetown. Her two children are currently attending secondary school. 

Abie has been in this business for 13 years and sells rice, local rice, dhal beans and sugar at her marketplace. Her business is her only source of income.  She says that her business is doing well. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more local foodstuff. Abie says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the good health of her family and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, dhal beans and sugar.

loans.name: Rahmonali

texts.ru: Рахмонали женатый отец троих детей. На рынке он занимается торговлей мужской одежды, что помогает ему в содержании своей семьи. Получение займа поможет ему в подготовке к осенне-зимнему сезону и расширению осенне-зимнего ассортимента своего товара и получению хороших доходов. Он заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за вашу помощь.
texts.en: Rahmonali is a married father of three children.  He sells men's clothing at the market, and this helps him to provide for his family.  Obtaining this loan will help Rahmonali with the preparation for the autumn-winter season, expansion of autumn-winter assortment of his merchandise and earning a good income.  He thanks all creditors in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old, married and has four adult children. She owns and manages a tailoring business making and selling curtains, bedsheets and pillowcases in her village. She has been operating this business for almost nine years now. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she is aiming to improve the business to earn a higher income to support her children's education.  

She wants to ask for an additional capital of P40,000 to buy the needed materials like fabrics, needles, threads and buttons for her tailoring business. She believes that she can able to improve the business and increase her income as she continues to work and manage her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, needle, threads and buttons for her tailoring business

loans.name: Ablavi Mathilde

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur avec 02 enfants en charge.
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques et des parfums depuis 1996. 
Elle est aidée par 01 personne et vend les produits dans un marché de la place après achat à Lomé et au Ghana.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des gammes multiples de parfum
Ablavi voudrait voir ses enfants prospérer et aider son mari.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 39-year-old woman.  She is married to a driver and has two children in her care.  Ablavi has been working as a re-seller of pharmaceutical products and perfumes since 1996.  She is helped by one person and sells her products in a market after buying them in Lomé and in Ghana.

Ablavi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy multiple lines of perfume.  She would like to see her children do well and help her husband.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products and perfumes

loans.name: Alaphia

texts.en:
Alaphia is 45 years old and widowed with two children, ages 4 and 18. She runs a bar and restaurant in Cabalatown, a neighborhood in Freetown. One of her children is currently attending school.

Alaphia has been in her business for four years, selling drinks and food at her bar and restaurant. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks and prepared foods.  Alphaia says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to open more branches of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and prepared foods.

loans.name: Inyemeramihigo Group

texts.fr:
Joël  fait partie du groupe Inyemeramihigo. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers». Il a 41 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 2 à 15 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  3 ans de secondaire.

Joël est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique. Dans les prochaines années, Joël voudrait faire des dépôts de riz pour distribuer des riz en grande quantité. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Joël is a member of the Inyemeramihigo group.  The group's name means 'performers'.  He is 41 years old, married, and has seven children from 2 to 15 years old.  Four of his children are in school.  He studied up to the third year of secondary school.

Joël is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop.

Joël's strategy for growing his business is to use chemical fertilizers.  In the coming years he would like to make stocks of rice so that he can distribute rice in large quantities.  With his profits, he plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident of Muranga where he practices farming and runs a butchery business. He is married with three children, two of whom are adults and the third is 12 years old. Julius is 48 and currently employs two farmhands on his farm in Muranga, Central Kenya where he also lives with the family.

Julius has requested for a loan of 30.000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a dairy unit. He says it will help protect his animals and improve his milk output as well as enable him buy more dairy cows. He also plans to improve the quality of his breeds.

Julius mentions drought as the major challenge in farming but remains optimistic and appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their support through farming loans.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata runs a pharmacy store in Calabatown, a neighborhood in Freetown. She has been in this business for three years and sells blood syrup, cold syrup, malaria drugs and baby food at her drugstore. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge in her business is price inflation.

Fatmata is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 11. She also takes care of six relatives as well as her immediate family.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more medicine and baby food. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open a clinic.

loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, cold syrup, malaria drugs and baby food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, snack foods, eggs, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose believes that the future depends on what we do in the present. He is doing his best for the better future of his family. Jose is 49 years of age, married and has five children. He has been managing a hog-raising business for five years.

Jose's profits from the business depend on the weight of the pigs. He can sell his hogs within four months of taking care of them and gain PHP 2,000 each. He can gain a higher income from the business if he gives the exact amount of feed for his pigs. Jose is asking for financial support of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of the hogs he raises. He believes that the loan will be a big help to gain a higher income from the business. His profits will serve as payment of his children's fees in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier, il est créé le 3 décembre 2007; les femmes ont pour principales activités le petit commerce et la sculpture.

Madame Diouldé la responsable est âgée de  ans ; elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants et a un en charge un autre; elle s'active dans la production de pilons, mortiers et autres articles artisanaux et a plus de 10 ans d'une bonne expérience; sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en et a levé la main 


Elle travaille au marché central de la ville et parcours les grands marchés des autres régions du pays à la recherche et vente de sculptures (statuettes, tableaux,mortiers).


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter beaucoup d'articles artisanaux afin de gagner plus de revenus.



Elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge familiale surtout pour la scolarité des enfants, avec ses bénéfices elle compte renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom is made up of eight women who live in the same neighborhood. It was created on December 3, 2007. The women’s main activity is retail and sculpture.

Mrs. Diouldé, the leader of the group is --- years old. She is married and the mother of four children, she also cares for another child. Her activity is the production of pestles, mortars and other handcrafted items. She has over 10 years of good experience. On the photo, she is standing on the right dressed in ----- and has her hand raised.

She works at the central market of the town and travels to large markets in other areas of the country searching for and selling sculptures.

She would like to use her loan to buy a lot of handcrafted items in order to earn a larger income.

She helps her husband with the household expenses, especially with the children’s school fees. She is planning on strengthening her savings with her profit.

loans.use: to purchase sculptures.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 26 years old and married to Peter who does a livestock business in order to add more income to the family. She has two children. She sells airtime credit cards for the Zain, Safaricom and YU lines. She has been in this business for four years and right now her monthly income is KES 15,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 10,000, which she plans to use to purchase more airtime credit cards. She hopes to plow back the anticipated profit into the business.

This is her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to continue with her business and to educate her kids.

loans.use: To buy Airtel, Safaricom and Yu airtime cards.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 40 years old and married with three children, between 6 and 25 years of age. She runs an electronics appliance store in Fullahtown in the central part of Freetown. She has two employees working with her. She also takes care of three relatives as well as her immediate ones. 

Fatmata has been in this business for three years and sells televisions and DVD sets at her store. She also earns income from a taxi business. She says that the main challenges to her businesses are insufficient capital and variation in price.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electronic appliances. Fatmata says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business and import more appliances.

loans.use: To purchase more televisions and DVD sets.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Nº2 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
David fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane no 2 / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie «let’s support each other». Il a 42 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 5 à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

David est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique. Dans les prochaines années, David voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour la culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
David is a member of the Tuzamurane no 2 - Rusizi group. The name of the group means “Let’s support each other”. He is 42 years old married with five children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. Four of them are in school. He has three years of  secondary education.

David is a rice farmer. This is his second loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

He plans to grow his business by using chemical fertilizers. In the next few years, David would like to purchase other fields for rice farming. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate his children.

loans.use: buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Nemarrau

texts.en: Nemarrau, 31-year-old married father of two, has been a farmer for the past six years.  This will be his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs like manure, seedlings . With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. An assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources, Nemarrau dreams of being a prominent farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, manure, seedlings.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 31 years old and married to Peter, is blessed with two children aged 6 to 12 years. Mary owns a retail shop selling supplies such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for the last six years and earns an income of KES.10,000 per month.

Now applying for her first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD., Mary plans to purchase a stock of sugar, salt, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and educate her children. A very hardworking woman, Mary hopes to start a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock including sugar, tea leaves, salt  and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of 5 and 16. She runs a general merchandise store in Fullahtown in the central part of Freetown. She has one employee with her and takes care of three relatives. 

Fatmata has been in this business for 10 years and sells drinks, bags, electric irons, needles, buttons and cream at her store. She also earns income from her husband's wholesales business. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital and price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks, bags, cream and electric irons. Fatmata says that the extra income from this loan will help her change her status and increase her savings. In the future, she would like to be a supplier.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, bags, creams, needles, buttons and electric irons.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a farmer and a father of three. Two of his children are adults and the youngest is nine years old and schooling. He has been in farming for 10 years in his hometown of Murang’a, in Central Kenya producing milk and selling to the local market.

Simon has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the loan to buy an additional dairy cow and hopes his milk production will improve his family's livelihood. He wants to own four dairy cows in the future.

Simon laments of the escalating cost of animal feed.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis is 48 years old, widowed and a mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. Her eldest son has a 10th standard education and now works in a bus stand and her youngest son works in a vegetable market. Her elder daughter couldn’t get an education due to her father’s death because all household responsibilities came down on her shoulders. Now she does decorative embroidery work at home with her mother. Her youngest daughter is involved in the same work. They all contribute to each other financially from their earnings so the financial circle of the home runs smoothly. 

Bilquis has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her decorative embroidery business. This has become a major source of earning. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material and clothes in bulk to be able to prepare beautiful embroidered clothes and increase their income. She is hopeful that the investment will take her business to a more profitable position. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bilquis.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material and clothes to decorate

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an extra computer

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.fr:
Zénabou est une femme  âgé(e) de 25 ans. Elle est mariée å un  électricien. Elle a 01 enfant.
