Zénabou travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2008 à Bé. Elle est reconnue par son talent culinaire. Zénabou a de nombreux clients qui viennent de part et d’autres de la ville pour manger chez elle.
Zénabou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits alimentaires et de la boisson. 
Dans les prochaines années. Elle prévoit  avoir une famille heureuse et acheter un terrain avec les profits réalisés.
texts.en:
Zénabou, aged 25, is married to an electrician and the mother of one child. She has been running a restaurant in Bé since 2008. She is well known for her culinary talent. She has many customers who come from various neighborhoods in town to her place and have a meal. Zénabou came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan in order to buy ingredients for her dishes and beverages.

In the years to come Zénabou wants to have a happy family. She intends to use her profit to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy soap, spaghetti, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a 44-year-old single lady, is a food vendor in Mshomoroni, Mombasa, and has been in this business for the last nine months. Jane was recently introduced to KADET, and this marks her first loan. With her business doing well, she will purchase additional stocks of cereals, maize meal, wheat flour, cooking oil, vegetables and a sack of charcoal.

The resulting extra profits will be directed to the repayment of the loan and the gradual expansion of her business. Jane's dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of cereals, maize meal, wheat flour, cooking oil, vegetables and a sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
Foday, a 50-year-old married father of six children between the ages of 11 and 27, four of whom are currently attending school, runs a provisions store in Calabatown in the eastern part in Freetown. In this business for 10 years, Foday sells milk, sugar, ovaltine and eggs, and also earns income from renting out a house. He says that his main business challenge is price inflation.

Requesting this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provision items, Foday says that the resulting extra income will help him improve his standard of living and educate his children. In the future, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, sugar, ovaltine and eggs.

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabumba, est un leader du groupe d’affaire "Maombi"elle est entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mariée, mère de 4 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un constructeur maître charpentier. Elle est vendeuse de poissons (frais, fumés, salés). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de Majengo. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 15 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut constitué par  son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec 6 paniers des poissons à marchander. En plus,elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement,accroitre son entreprise.La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé en mains.
texts.en:
The leader of the Maombi business group, is a 35-year-old entrepreneur, married with four young children. Her husband does construction work as a master carpenter.

She is a fishmonger (fresh, smoked, salted fish), and offers her products at the Majengo community market. She has been generating income through these small activities for over ten years and has just completed 15 credit cycles with Hekima. Her initial capital was provided by her husband.

This new credit will serve to buy six baskets of fish for retail sales. Moreover, she wants to see her children grow up comfortably and wants to expand her business. She wishes to thank the Hekima organisation for its actions on behalf of impoverished women excluded from conventional banking. It should be noted that one of the group members is holding her baby in her arms.

loans.use: buy six baskets of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nonghin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABOU est la représentante du groupe Nonghin. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Trois(03) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de pagnes depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut ajouter de l’argent pour s’acheter une balle de pagnes.

Mme avec ses économies contribue à l’épanouissement de son foyer et épargne un peu. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagnes et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. ZOENABOU is the representative of Nonghin Group. She's married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 19, the youngest is 10. All three of them attend school. She has five persons to support.

She's been selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) for five years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are both women and men.

She would like to have additional money to buy one bale of pagnes. With her savings, she helps her household to thrive. She ambitions to open a large pagnes store and help her children to study.

loans.use: to buy one bale of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Hawa Francess

texts.en:
Hawa, a 43-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 10 and 28, runs a pharmacy in Georgebrook, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also takes care of two relatives.

Hawa has owned this business for 10 years and employs one person to assist her as she sells cough syrup, blood tonic and malaria medicines. She also earns income from renting out a house. Her main business challenge is a lack of sufficient finance.

Hawa has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cough syrup, malaria medicines and blood tonic. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to become a supplier.

loans.use: to purchase more cough syrup, blood tonic and malaria medicines.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 22-year-old young man. He is a university student and he has a project of computers sales, which is a source of income to help pay his university fees, as his father is a worker with a decent salary.

Ibrahem wants to expand his project and increase his sales by purchasing more computers for sale, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When he gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase more computers to increase his sales, which means an increase in his income to enable him to continue his studies and live in better life conditions. 

Ibrahem is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for sale.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, who is 49 years old, lives in the village of Tsinsvla, located in the Adjara region, where he earns a living growing fruit on the 0.4 hectare plot of land that he owns, selling his harvest to local greengrocery retailers. He also grows flowers and makes wine, selling locally.

Having already purchased grapes in the Kakheti region, Davit is requesting a loan to purchase sugar for wine production. The wine will be ready for sale by December, and he plans to reinvest the profit in his farming activities in order to develop them and increase profitability.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for wine production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old.  He is married and blessed with three children.  He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years.  Joseph's farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for corn farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.  He has been a good client with KADET and this will be his fifth loan with which he is planning to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming which will increase his corn production.  He would also like to educate his children with the profit.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.
Joseph is a fastidious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata is 41 years old and married with one child, who is nine years old.  She runs a general merchandise store in Fullahtown in the central part of Freetown.  She also has one employee working with her.

Isata has been in this business for five years and sells soap, paste, sardines and bread at her store.  She also earns income from a business of selling local food items.  She says that the main challenges to her businesses are low incomes, inflation, and transportation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soap, paste, sardines, and bread.  Isata says that the extra income from this loan will help her change her family's entire life.  In the future, she would like to have an international business.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, paste, sardines, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some sacks of corn to add to his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle to add to his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Domitilah

texts.en:
Domitilah is a 27-year-old, single lady. She is a tailor. She has been in this business for the last eleven years and it has been a success. 

Domitilah was recently introduced to KADET LTD. This marks her first time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase more cloth material for tailoring.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth material for tailoring.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 40-years-old and married with 4 children, ages between 4 and 22. She runs a bar and restaurant in Kissy in the eastern part of Freetown. She also takes care of three relative as well as her immediate family.  

Isatu has owns this business for 20 years and sells beer, Maltina, soft drinks, and preparing food at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks and food stuff.  Isatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to open another out let.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, maltina and preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals for sale.

loans.name: Şükriye

texts.en:
Şükriye is married with 4 grown children, the eldest being 32 and the youngest 27 years old.  Before she started working, she was a housewife and she was able to meet her immediate household expenses by knitting shawls and washcloths. Because of her husband’s illness, she thought that she must earn more money, and with her daughter’s support, she began to sell ladies’ undergarments. Şükriye has been doing this kind of work for 3 years.  With the loan that she gets from Maya, she wants to improve her overall business and increase her customer base by offering a wider variety of items for sale and by increasing her inventory.  With the funds and support she receives from Maya, she believes she will be able to increase her sales in the village markets that she goes to.  That is her current plan.  Her future plan, if all works out the way she wants it to, is to buy herself a house, no matter how small.  As for her plans for her family, her children all being married, she wants to help in the education of her grandchildren as much as she can, and to be able to provide better care for her sick husband.  In spite of her age, Şükriye is an industrious and persevering woman. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff


Şükriye evli ve 4 yetişmiş çocuğu var, en büyüğü 32, en küçüğü 27 yaşında.  Bu işe başlamadan önce ev hanımıydı, evde lif ve şal örerek mutfak masrafını çıkarıyordu.  Eşinin rahatsızlığından dolayı, daha çok para kazanmalıyım diye düşündü ve kızınında desteği ile iç giyim satışına başladı.  Şükriye bu işi üç yıldan beri yapıyor.  Maya’dan almış olduğu kredi ile daha çok çeşit ve daha fazla mal alarak işlerini yoluna koyup müşteri potansiyelini artırmak istiyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi sayesinde, şimdi köy pazarlarına giderek daha çok satış yapacağına inanıyor.  Planları da bu yönde zaten.  Gelecek için planları ise, işleri istediği gibi giderse kendine küçük de olsa ev alabilmek.  Ailesi için planları ise, çocuklarının hepsi evli ,elinden geldiği kadar torunlarına eğitimlerinde yardımcı olabilmek ve hasta olan eşine daha iyi şartlarda bakabilmek. Yaşına rağmen çok gayretli ve yılmaz bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en: Mahmood is a 28-year-old young man. He works in agriculture which is the only source of income for him. His father is also working in agriculture and his brother is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Mahmood wants to prepare for the coming winter season by purchasing seedlings and needed fertilizers, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for the purchase, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Mahmood gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase the needed seedlings and fertilizers to prepare for the coming winter season by being ready to have good crops for sale and compete with others to increase his income and live in better living conditions. Mahmood is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers preparing for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Leena

texts.en: Leena is a 30 year old young woman.  She is married with one son, and her husband is a doctor and has a medical laboratory.  The family also has another source of income from agriculture.  Leena wants to help her husband in purchasing some medical equipment for the laboratory, but the amount of money she has is not enough to pay for it.  So she needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN.  When Leena gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, that will enable her to help her husband get the medical equipment.  This equipment will help to expand and improve his work and increase his income which will help to provide better life conditions for the family.  Leena is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in his laboratory.

loans.use: To purchase laboratory medical equipment for the laboratory that her husband owns.

loans.name: Hudun

texts.en:
Hudun is 34 years old and married with two children aged 11 and 4 years old.  He is a farmer and has been in the farming business for the last 6 years producing coffee and corn for the local market.  His wife runs a milling business in the local market.

Hudun has requested a first loan of 63,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow for a dairy farming venture.  He says the dairy cow will improve his farming income and enable him to improve his family's living standards as well as spread his farming risk.

He says the high costs of feeds and drought are challenges the farmers are grappling with.  He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo support for smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is 37 years old and married with two children aged 16 and 5.  Both her children are in school.  She has been farming for seven years and currently produces wheat, milk, and vegetables for the local market.  She has two farmhands and she receives additional income from her taxi business.

Hellen has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She says the additional income will improve her farming income and enable her to educate her children and improve the general living standards of her family.

She mentions animal diseases as the major challenge in the farming business but remains optimistic about the growth.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk grains, toilet paper, soup, canned goods, matches, cigarettes, bread, soda, and other products.

loans.name: Jessica Eunice

texts.es:
Yessica, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 8,4 y 2 años de edad, ella administra una pupuseria donde tambien ofrece bebidas: gaseosas, chocolate y refrescos, ademas vende hot dog de (salchicha y de pollo) todos los días, de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar  materia prima como (maíz, quesillo chicharon, salchichas, pan para hot dog y bebidas) de esa forma podrá tener más ingresos y tendrá siempre lo necesario para mantener el negocio.
El sueño de Yessica  es que el negocio crezca y poder aumentar en sus ingresos y tener lo necesario para vivir mejor y que su familia sea feliz.
texts.en:
Yessica, a single mother, has three children, ages 8, 4, and 2.  She manages a "pupusería" [a business selling "pupusas," stuffed tortillas], where she also offers beverages (sodas, hot chocolate, and soft drinks) and sells sausage and chicken hot dogs every day, from Monday through Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients (such as corn, soft cheese, cracklings, sausages, hot dog rolls, and drinks) so she will be able to have more income and everything she always needs to run the business.

Yessica's dream is for her business to grow, to be able to increase her earnings, and to have everything she needs to live better and for her family to be happy.

loans.use: to buy corn, soft cheese, sausages, bread, and beverages.

loans.name: Nigdalia Irela

texts.es: Nigdalia Irela tiene 47 años, su actividad es un quiosco que tiene más de 3 años en este negocio, está ubicado en un centro de salud en donde es muy frecuentado por trabajadores de este lugar. Aprendió este negocio por cuenta propia y con el apoyo de sus hermanos que le ayudaron a tener este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pan, galletas, refrescos, golosinas, repostería y jugos. Sueña con seguirle ayudando a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien y además puedan obtener estudios.
texts.en: Nigdalia Irela is 47 years old. She has a kiosk and has been in the business for more than three years. Her kiosk is located in a health center and is frequented by many who work there. She learned this business on her own and with the support of her brothers who helped her to have this way of making a living. The purpose of the loan is to buy bread, cookies, soft drinks, candy, pastries, and juice. She dreams of continuing to help her children so that they'll be upstanding people and also so they can get an education.

loans.use: to buy bread, cookies, soft drinks, candy, pastries, and juice.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, vive con su hija en casa familiar, ella se dedica a vender ropa: short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas, caballeros y niños, el negocio lo tiene en el centro de la ciudad, desde hace cinco años se dedica a este oficio, ademas en sus momentos libres cose ropa en su propia maquina.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio, y comprar más ropa: pantalones, camisas, blusas y de esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño de Zoila  es tener una mejor calidad de vida y que su hija estudie, y que en el futuro sea profesional.
texts.en:
Zoila lives in her family home.  She sells clothing for women, men, and children: shorts, skirts, pants, blouses.  Her business is in the city center.  She has been doing this work for five years.  In her spare time, she also sews clothes with her own machine.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business and buy more clothing: pants, shirts, and blouses.  In this way she will increase her profits because she will have more variety to offer her customers.

Zoila's dream is to have a better quality of life and for her daughter to study and be a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Gbevivi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEVIVI est composé de douze personnes qui habitent dans le même village.C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe,du nom de Féliciènne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Féliciènne est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Féliciènne est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Pascal. Le couple à quatre enfants  dont trois restent encore à leur charge. Féliciènne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Féliciènne mène comme activité depuis douze ans la vente des céréales( maïs et soja). Féliciènne s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Féliciènne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEVIVI, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
GBEVIVI Group is made up of twelve persons who live in the same village. This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Féliciènne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 40 years old and lives in Benin. She's married to a cultivator named Pascal. The couple has four children, out of whom they still have three to support.

Féliciènne lives together with her husband and children, and the couple shares support for the family needs. To manage it, she's been selling cereals (corn and soy) for twelve years.

She gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets. Eager to satisfy her customer and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking her first loan, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and soy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, steel, and other products.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BON BERGER est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe,du nom de Esther est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Esther est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Esther est mariée à un secrétaire du nom de Salomon. Le couple à un enfant, scolarisé, et à leur charge.Esther vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant.Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Esther vend des boissons en canette et des savons.Esther s’approvisionne au Togo Etat voisin du voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Esther sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BON BERGER un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Bon Berger Group ("the good shepherd") is composed of three people knowing one another through their business activities. This is the second time that the group members came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for financial assistance in order to raise their activity level.

The group is represented by Esther, who is pictured raising her hand. She is 36 years old and lives in Benin. Esther is married to Salomon, a secretary. They have one child, who attends school and is in their care. Esther lives with her husband and their child. In order to provide for her needs and those of her child, Esther sells canned beverages and soap. She gets her supplies in Togo, a country bordering on Benin. Eager to satisfy her clientele and increase her turnover and income, Esther joins the other members of Bon Berger Group and applies for a second loan.

loans.use: to buy canned beverages and soap.

loans.name: Amies De Jesus Group

texts.fr: AMIES DE JESUS est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Marie Rose. Les membres du groupe sont des amies et pratiquent la même religion. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement,ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marie Rose est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à Constant un militaire. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à leur charge. Marie Rose a  fréquenté l’école jusqu'au cours secondaire.Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Marie Rose et son mari. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Marie Rose vend des bois de chauffage. A côté de cette activité Marie Rose vend des produits divers.Marie Rose exerce cette activité depuis près de cinq ans. Marie Rose s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Marie Rose et aux autres membres du groupe AMIES DE JESUS, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
AMIES DE JESUS is a group comprised of three persons whose representative (the one in the photo with her hand raised) is called Marie Rose. The group members are friends and have the same religion. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Marie Rose is 50 years old and married to Constant, a soldier. They have four children, all in school. Two of the children remain in their care. She has attended middle school. The various household expenses are covered by her and her husband. To support herself and her family, Marie Rose sells firewood. Aside from this work, she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for nearly five years. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. 

This second loan will surely enable Marie Rose and the other members of the group AMIES DE JESUS to boost their business and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy firewood and a variety of goods

loans.name: Roxana Marisol

texts.es:
Roxana, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica a vender mariscos en el mercado del pueblo, el oficio lo inicio hace tres años, todos los días vende sábado y domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería (punches, pescado, camarones) para mejorar en las ventas y tener  variedad y aumentando la afluencia de la clientela.
El propósito de Roxana es comprar un vehículo, para transportar la venta a diferentes pueblos y tener más clientes y obtener  ganancias.
texts.en:
Roxana lives with her husband and two children. She sells seafood in the the town market. She started doing this work three years ago. She sells every day, including Saturday and Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise (crab, fish, and shrimp) in order to improve her sales, have variety, and attract more customers. Roxana's aim is to buy a vehicle, so that she can transport her seafood to different towns, have more customers, and make profits.

loans.use: To buy fish, crab and shrimp.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 37 years old and married with three children, aged between 8 and 15.  She runs a provisions store in Grassfield located in the eastern part of Freetown.  Her three children are currently attending school.

Isatu has been in this business for 10 years and sells milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise and sardines at her store.  She also earns income from renting out a house.  She says that the main challenges to her business are inflation and during rainy season low sales.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more milk, sardines, sugar, butter, and mayonnaise.  Isatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children.  In the future, she would like to open a super market.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, sardines, sugar, butter, and mayonnaise to sell.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: María José es una joven con un gran carisma ella se dedica a la venta de ladrillo de barro. Desde hace más de 3 años, que tiene este negocio el esfuerzo que realiza a diario le brinda lo necesario para proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario. Además María José estudia los sábados y es por medio de su negocio que ha logrado pagarse los estudios hasta los momentos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ladrillos en mayor cantidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María José is a young woman with great charisma. She sells mud bricks. She has had this business for more than three years, and the hard work that she does every day provides what she needs to feed her family. 

In addition, María José goes to school on Saturdays, and by means of her business, she has managed to pay for her studies until now.

The purpose of the loan is to buy bricks in greater quantity, to meet demand from her customers.

loans.use:
compra de ladrillos en mayor cantidad
To buy bricks in greater quantity.

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE est un groupe constitué de onze personnes et dont la représentante, (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Bertille. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même village au Bénin.Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Bertille est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à Michel un revendeur. Le couple a trois enfants à charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Bertille n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Bertille vend du maïs et de la farine de manioc. A côté de cela Bertille vend produits divers et des poulets. Bertille exerce cette activité depuis près de vingt ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Bertille s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à  Bertille et aux autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Missimide Group is made up of eleven people. It is represented by Bertille, who is pictured raising her hand. The group members live in the same village in Benin. In order to increase their working capital the group members came for the second time to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for a loan.

Bertille is 39 years old and married to Michel, a retailer. They have three children, all in their care, with two of them attending school. Bertille herself never went to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her family, Bertille sells corn and cassava flour. In addition, she sells various products and chickens. Bertille has been in this activity for nearly 20 years, which enables her to provide with her husband for household expenses. Bertille gets her supplies in a city in Benin. This second loan will for sure enable Bertille and the other members of Missimide Group to raise their activity level, expand their clientele and increase their income. Their first loan has been paid off on schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and cassava flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic staples, detergents, bread, matches, cookies and other products for her store.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 50 years old and widowed with four children, aged between 12 and 27.  She runs a local food commodities store in Calabatown, a neighborhood in Freetown.  Three of her children are currently attending school.

Marie has been in this business for 15 years and sells groundnut, beans, garri, and cassava at her store.  She also earns income from renting out a house.  She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation problems and inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more local food items.  Marie says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more local food items such as groundnut, beans, garri, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI est composé de douze personnes qui habitent dans le même village au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Micheline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Micheline est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un technicien agricole du nom de Dieu-Donné. Le couple à deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Micheline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Micheline mène comme activité la vente des produits cosmétiques. A côté de cette activité, Micheline vend des sucreries ( Bissap,Yaourt etc.). Micheline mène cette activité depuis vingt ans. Micheline s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Micheline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI, un premier crédit.
texts.en: Fifonsi Group is made up of twelve people, all living in the same village in Benin. This is the first time that the group members came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for financial assistance in order to raise their activity level. The group is represented by Micheline, who is pictured raising her hand. She is 38 years old and married to Dieu-Donné, an agricultural operative. They have two children, both in their care and attending school. Micheline lives with her husband and their children. The parents share household expenses. To this end Micheline sells cosmetics and sweet products, such as hibiscus tea and yoghurt. Micheline has been in this activity for 20 years. She gets her supplies at the largest market in Benin. Eager to satisfy her clientele and increase her turnover and income, Micheline joins the other members of Fifonsi Group and applies for the group's first loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, sugar and hibiscus.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos.

Francisco aprendió a fabricar hamacas desde los 10 años, su abuela le enseñó el oficio despues de que la madre de Francisco falleciera. Dedicandose a la agricultura y a la fabricación de hamacas Francisco pudo criar a todos sus hijos, quienes se dedican al mismo oficio.

Francisco solicitó un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de pita y zoga para la elaboración de hamacas. El préstamo le facilitará a Francisco el poder comprar sus insumos en mayores cantidades, y asi pagar un precio más bajo (precio de mayorista). De esta forma Francisco podrá tener una mejor utilidad.

En un futuro Fracisco planea tener otra actividad aparte de las hamacas. Planea comercializar ganado y cerdos. Le gustaría tener su propia granja y asi poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is 64 years old.  He is married with 5 children.  He learned to how weave hammocks ten years ago. His grandmother taught him the trade after his mother died.  In addition to weaving hammocks, he is also a farmer. These jobs have enabled him to raise his children, who are engaged in the same businesses.  The loan will make it possible for Francisco to buy his supplies in bulk at a lower, wholesale price.  In this way, Francisco will earn a better profit.  In the future, Francisco plans to engage in other activities besides making hammocks.  He plans to market cattle and pigs.  He would like to have his own farm, which would enable him to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave hammocks.

loans.name: Arlen Ydania

texts.es: Arlen Ydania tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, el arduo trabajo que realiza para ver los frutos de su trabajo diariamente. Además Arlen es maestra de primaria fue por medio de su salario que logro comprar ciertos productos y además mostrarles sus productos a sus compañeros de trabajo ha sido así que ella ha podido sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, prendas de plata y oro laminado entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Arlen Ydania is 30 years old and sells general merchandise.  She has had this business for more than nine years, the hard work she does to see the fruits of her labor every day.

Arlen also teaches elementary school.  It was by means of her salary that she managed to buy certain products and show them to her coworkers.  This has been how she has been able to defray the costs of her home.

The purpose of the loan is to buy purses, shoes, clothing in general, cosmetics, gold- and silver-plated jewelry, and other products.

loans.use: to buy purses, shoes, clothing in general, cosmetics, gold- and silver-plated jewelry, and other products.

loans.name: Jose Matias

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos 5 y 6 años D. edad, el se dedica a vender mariscos y articulos D. chatarra (aluminio, hierro, latas)el oficio lo inicio hace tres años, todos los días venD., no tiene un horario establecido sábado y domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería pescado, camarones, langostas, apretadores, esta inversion ayudara para mejorar en las ventas y tener  variedad, tambien aumentar en clientela.
El propósito D. José es, que sus ingresos aumenten, tener más clientes y obtener más  ganancias, D. esa manera ayudar con los gastos D.  la casa.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, aged 5 and 6.  He works selling seafood and scrap metal (aluminium, iron, cans).  He has been working in this business for three years, and sells every day.  He doesn't have a fixed schedule on the weekends.

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise: fish, shrimp, lobsters, etc.  This investment will help him to improve his sales and offer variety a products; it will also help him grow his customer base.

José's plan is for his income to grow, to have more customers, and to earn better money so that he can help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, lobsters, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more local products such as cola nuts, groundnuts, garri, and coal.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis tiene 41 años, es acompañado, y tiene dos hijos.

Jose Luis lleva 20 años dedicandose a trabajar como jornalero. Dicho oficio lo aprendió de su padre. El vive en la hacienda donde trabaja, y tiene un dia libre en la semana para ir a visitar a su familia.

Jose Luis cosecha maíz para el consumo de su familia, y para comprar sus insumos él viaja una media hora a una ciudad vecina. Jose Luis siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, y ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de insumos para su cultivo. Además de los insumos, Jose Luis quiere comprar unos cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Con la siembra Jose Luis asegura tener maíz todo el año para el consumo e su familia. Los cerdos le proporcionaran un ingreso adicional a su salario de jornalero.

En un futuro Jose Luis quiere tener una crianza de cerdos. Su jefe le está dando la oportunidad de tener los cerdos en su granja para que Jose Luis se pueda superar. En un futuro Jose Luis quisiera tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 41 years old.  He has a significant other, and has two children.

For the last 20 years, Jose Luis has been working as a day-laborer, a trade he learned from his father.  He lives on the farm where he works, and has one day off a week to go visit his family.

Jose Luis grows corn for his family's consumption, and travels for half an hour to a nearby city to purchase his farming supplies.  Jose Luis plants 7,000 square meters of corn, and has asked for a loan from Fundación Campo for the purchase of supplies for his farming.  In addition to these supplies, Jose Luis wants to buy some pigs to fatten and sell.  With the planting, Jose Luis will ensure that he has corn throughout the year for his family's consumption. The pigs will provide him with an additional source of income to his salary as a day-laborer.

In the future, Jose Luis would like to have a pig-raising business.  His boss is giving him the opportunity to keep the pigs in his farm, so that Jose Luis can  do well.

In the future, Jose Luis would also like to own his own home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn, and to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 54 años es casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años, vive con su familia en Cotacachi que se encuentra a 30 minutos de Ibarra en el norte de Ecuador. Segundo se describe como una persona de buenos sentimientos que le gusta ayudar a las personas que mas lo necesiten.

Segundo trabaja con su esposa en la agricultura específicamente en el cultivo de fréjol. Es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, este último va a ser invertido en la compra de abono, fumigantes, palos, alambre y piolas para el sembrío de fréjol, lo cual le va a ayudar a que su producto sea de buena calidad y así podrá obtener buenos ingresos y podrá darle el estudio a su hijo.

Su sueño es comprar más terrenos para poder seguir cultivando y poder dejar de herencia a su hijo para que siga produciendo fréjol.
texts.en:
Segundo is 54, married, and has a 15 year-old son. He lives with his family in Cotacachi, which is located 30 minutes from Ibarra in the northern part of Ecuador. Segundo describes himself as a caring person, who likes to help the people who need it most. Segundo works with his wife in farming; specifically in growing beans. 

He is applying for his third loan from Fodemi. He will use this latest loan to buy fertilizers, crop sprays, poles, wires and twine for growing beans. This will help him ensure that his crop is of good quality, and this way he will be able to get good income and be able to pay for his son's education. 

His dream is to buy more land in order to continue farming, and to leave it to his son as a legacy, so that he keeps growing beans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, crop sprays, poles, wire, and twine for growing beans.

loans.name: Blanca Vilma

texts.es:
Blanca Vilma tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos (3 son adultos).

DesD. hace 3 años Blanca Vilma se dedica a la venta D. pescado. Ella trabaja con su esposo, quien es pescador. Su esposo sale a pescar todos los dias a las 3pm y pesca toda la noche. A las 5am Blanca Vilma lo espera a las afueras D. la laguna donD. él pesca para recoger el pescado y salir a venderlo. Para vender el pescado, Blanca Vilma coloca la pesca en una bandeja con hielo y se transporta en bus hacia una ciudad vecina. Una vez en la ciudad, Blanca Vilma venD. el pescado D. casa en casa. Su jornada termina a la 1 pm, cuando Blanca Vilma está D. regreso en su hogar.

Blanca Vilma ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra D. una canoa. Actualmente, ella y su esposo pagan por el alquiler D. una canoa para poder pescar. Con una canoa propia Blanca Vilma espera poder mejorar los ingresos su familia.

En un futuro Blanca Vilma planea poder comprar otra canoa más, y así sus hijos tambien pueden pescar. Con la venta D. mas pescado, Blanca Vilma quisiera comprar un vehículo. D. esta forma, ella podría usar el vehiculo para salir a vender.
texts.en:
Blanca Vilma is 43 years old.  She is married, and has five children (three of whom are adults).

For the last three years, Blanca Vilma has been working selling fish.  She works with her husband, who is a fisherman.  Her husband goes out to fish every day at 3 p.m., and fishes throughout the night.  At 5 a.m., Blanca Vilma waits for him at the edge of the lagoon where he does his fishing, to receive the fish and take them for sale.  

In order to sell the fish, Blanca Vilma puts them on a tray with ice and transports them by buy to a nearby city.  Once there, Blanca Vilma sells the fish door-to-door.  Her day finishes at 1 p.m., at which point Blanca Vilma returns home.

Blance Vilma has requested a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase a canoe.  Currently, she and her husband pay to rent a canoe in order to be able to fish.  With their own canoe, Blanca Vilma expects to be able to improve her household income.

In the future Blanca Vilma plans to be able to purchase one more canoe, so that her children will also be able to fish.  By selling more fish, Blanca Vilma would like to be able to buy a vehicle, which she would be able to use for going to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy a canoe for catching fish for her to sell.

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en:
Nenneh is 35 years old and married with 5 children. Her 5 children are currently attending school. She runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo, near Freetown.  

Nenneh has been in this business for 6 years and sells sugar, salt, flour, Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), and tomato paste at the marketplace. She says that her business is doing well. The family also earns income from her husband's business. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food commodities. Nenneh says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more food commodities such as sugar, salt, flour and Maggi.

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es:
Jose Amadeo tiene 54 años, es viudo y tiene 6 hijos.

Jose Amadeo trabaja como agricultor desde los 12 años. Este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, y con dicha profesión ha conseguido sostener a sus hijos; incluso después de haber quedado viudo hace más de 10 años.

Jose Amadeo solicita un préstamo de Fundación Campo para comprar abono, pesticidas, y otros insumos para su cosecha. Con dichos insumos Jose Amadeo podrá cosechar un buen producto para luego comercializarlo. Su cosecha actualmente está en muy buen estado dada la abundante lluvia durante esta temporada.

En un futuro Jose Amadeo planea mejorar el techo de su casa y construir otra habitación para que sus hijos puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Jose Amadeo is 54 years old.  He is a widower, and has six children.

Jose Amadeo has been working as a farmer for the last 12 years.  He learned this trade from his father, and through his profession he has been able to provide for his children, even after becoming a widower over 10 years ago.

Jose Amadeo is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy manure, pesticides and other supplies for his crops.  With these supplies, Jose Amadeo will be able to harvest a good crop for subsequent sale.  His current crop is in very good shape thanks to the abundant rain they've had this season.

In the future, Jose Amadeo plans to improve his home's roof and build another room so that his children can live better.

loans.use: to buy manure and other supplies for his corn crop.

loans.name: Ramiro Javier

texts.es: El sr. Ramiro es peluquero, lleva en esta actividad  hace bastante tiempo, nació en la ciudad de Potosí, actualmente radica en esta localidad de el torno en el zona Villa Norte,  tiene su esposa la Sra. Martha  la cual le ayuda en el negocio ella también  se dedica a realizar cortes y tintes a Damas, ambos trabajan juntos desde que inicio el negocio de peluquería cuentan con un hijo que  estudia, han solicitado un crédito para la compra de un lote de terreno al crédito (habitad),  son clientes antiguos y responsables ya van por su tercera secuencia y nuevamente están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo económico que les ha brindado  para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Ramiro is a barber; he has been doing this for quite some time.  He was born in the city of Potosí, and currently lives in El Torno in the Villa Norte region.  

He is married to Señora Martha, who helps him in the business as she does women's haircuts and color.  They have been working together since they started their hair salon.  They have one son who is a student.

They have requested a loan for the purchase of a piece of land on credit (to live on).  They are long-standing and responsible clients as they are coming back for their third loan.  They are very grateful to the lending institution for the financial help that has been provided to them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land on credit.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married and has 4 children. She attended a vocational school. Georgina sells cosmetics, utensils, and hair products in the village of Jukwa near Abura, which she has done for 10 years. She supports her husband in educating, feeding, and clothing their children. She will use the loan to purchase additional cooking utensils and hair products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking utensils and hair products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana, necesita comprar ropa, su negocio ha mejorado debido a las compras que a través de préstamos ella ha realizado, actualmente quiere comprar, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, con la nueva compra estará surtiendo de nuevos estilos.
Su negocio ha mejorado, la clientela esta encontrando en su negocio muchos articulos que son necesarios para vestir.
texts.en:
Ana needs to buy clothes.  Her business has improved as a result of the purchases that she has made with her loans.  She would currently like to buy men's and women's underwear.  Through this new purchase, she will be able to stock her business with new styles.

Ana's business has improved.  Her customers are finding many items of clothes that they need in her business.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's underwear

loans.name: Kijembe Group

texts.en:
Ashifa, who is in her early 30s, is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She has had a business selling clothes for the past two years. She works from 8 a.m to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs to sell. She sells door to door. Her dream is to one day be able to open a beauty salon.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kijembe," which has a total of 16 members. Members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs

loans.name: Claudia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Claudia, pensando siempre en el negocio y tratando D. mejorarlo, se ha decidido por continuar inyectando mercadería, que le permita crecer y abastecer a los clientes en su demanda, este nuevo préstamo le servirá para la compra D. gaseosas, boquitas, dulces, galletas, jugos y gaseosas.
La inversion espera que le ayuD. como la anterior a mantener satisfechos a los clientes, así mismo que pueda generar ganancias, ademas D. tratar siempre D. estar puntual con el prestamo.
texts.en: Claudia is always thinking of her business and trying to improve it. She has decided to continue putting merchandise into it that will allow her to grow and meet her customers' demand. This new loan will be used to buy soft drinks, snacks, candies, and juices. She hopes that the investment will help her keep her customers satisfied and generate earnings. She will strive to always pay for the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, candies, cookies, and juices.

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 27 años es casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive con su familia en Cotacachi que se encuentra a 30 min de Ibarra en el Norte de Ecuador. Blanca se describe como una persona trabajadora, honesta, alegre y comprometida con lo que hace.

Blanca trabaja sola en la crianza de chanchos, lo realiza desde que era niña con sus padres ya que le gustan los animales. Es el primer crédito que le solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de bloques, cemento para la reconstrucción de la chanchera porque ya se esta detereorando, la ampliación de esta chanchera le ayudará a tener mas animales ya así poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos acaben de estudiar y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Blanca, 27, is married and has four children.  She lives with her family in Cotacachi which is located 30 minutes from Ibarra in northern Ecuador.  Blanca describes herself as a hardworking, honest, cheerful person who is committed to what she does.

Blanca works alone raising pigs.  She’s done this since she was little helping her parents because she likes animals.  This is her first loan request to Fodemi and she’s going to use it to buy concrete blocks and cement to rebuild her pig pens because they are deteriorated.  Expanding the pens will help her have more animals and be able to increase sales and income.  Her dream is that her children complete their schooling and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks and cement to repair her pig pens.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, está solicitando nuevamente préstamo, ya que el anterior le sirvió para comprar productos para el negocio en la venta de Hot dog, lo que también ocasiono que las ventas aumentaran y poder pagar el préstamo, actualmente lo invertirá en compra de embutidos, aderezos y pan, para la venta de Hot Dog.
Esta contento de recibir este apoyo, ya que le ayuda dandole oportunidad para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is asking for a new loan. The previous one was used to buy products for his hot dog selling business. This made his sales go up and enabled him to make the loan payments. At present, he will invest in buying hot dogs, toppings and hot dog buns to sell hot dogs. 

He is happy to receive this support, since the help is giving him the opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, toppings and hotdog buns.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Américo, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, por la buena atención y servicio que se le brinda, dándole los prestamos en un plazo corto, los cuales ha invertido en el negocio, por el momento comprara pollo, arroz, carne, condimentos y otros productos para el negocio.
Con los préstamos su condición en el negocio ha mejorado, también los ingresos han sido mayores.
texts.en: Américo decided on a new loan given the level of care and attention that it gives him, offering him short-term loans, which he has invested in his business. For the moment he will buy chicken, rice, meat and seasonings and other products for the business. With the loans his status in the business has improved as has the income which has been greater.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, meat and seasonings.

loans.name: Ruth Yory

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth se dedica   a la venta de salteña y de pan casero, desde muy tempranas horas del día prepara sus masas, la Sra. tiene 48 años, esta casada con el señor Oscar quien es tornero pero por el momento le ayuda a su esposa en el negocio repartiendo junto con ella sus productos, tiene  4 hijos todos estudian, realiza sus ventas por diferentes partes de la ciudad, viven por la zona del plan 3000, trabajan de lunes a domingo, su panadería se encuentra en su propio domicilio. La Sra. Ruth es clienta de  la institución, es una persona responsable que demostró buen historial de pago también algunos fines de semana vende comida, su esposo le colabora con la entrega de salteñas, pero quiere reabrir nuevamente su taller de tornería es por eso que solicito el crédito para la compra de calaminas para  ampliación de un tinglado. Son personas que luchan para ver a sus hijos profesionales, ese es su deseo.
texts.en:
Ruth sells home-made bread and turnovers [salteñas].  She starts preparing her dough very early in the morning.  She is 48 years old and married to Oscar who is a lathe operator but currently helps his wife in the business delivering her products with her.  She has four children who are all going to school.  Her sales happen throughout the various parts of the city.  They live in the Plan 3000 neighborhood and work Monday through Sunday.  Her bakery is located in her home.

Ruth is a client of the institution.  She’s a responsible person who exhibited good repayment history.  Occasionally on weekends she also sells food.  Her husband helps her deliver the turnovers but he’d like to reopen his metal shop and this is the reason for the loan request: to buy plywood sheets to enlarge a shed.  They are people who struggle to see their children become professionals; this is their wish.

loans.use: to buy sheets of plywood to build a small shed.

loans.name: Dany Rosibel

texts.es: Dany, utilizara un nuevo préstamo en la compra D. maíz, tomates, papas, queso, para el fortalecimiento del negocio, los anteriores le han ayudado para mantenerse y además para mejorar las ventas a los clientes. Su condicion en la familia ha mejorado, al igual que el negocio, espera que con este nuevo pueda cancelarlo oportunamente para continuar recibiendo este apoyo.
texts.en: Dany will use a new loan to purchase corn, tomatoes, potatoes, cheese to strengthen her business. The previous loans have helped her maintain her business and also improve sales to customers. Her family condition has improved as has the business. She hopes to repay the new loan promptly so as to continue receiving this support.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomatoes, potatoes and cheese.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is 33 years old and married with 2 children, ages 7 and 17, both of whom attend school. She runs a beauty salon in Waterloo near Freetown and has 6 employees working with her.

Rosaline has owned this business for 15 years, providing nail care, hair styling and beauty services at her salon. Her business is her only source of income. She says that her business is doing well.

Rosaline has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy new beauty supplies to sell to her salon customers and to develop her business. Rosaline says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to open more branches.

loans.use: To buy new beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Deivid

texts.es: El joven Deivid nacido en Santa Cruz, el es  soltero tiene 19 años  vive en la casa junto a sus Padres, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado la comunidad Junta Pirai, su actividad económica es servicio de transporte publico del Torno hacia la Calera con una experiencia de un año, con esta actividad el joven Deivid ayuda a sus Papas con los gastos de l hogar, es un joven muy trabajador y a pesar de su corta edad muy responsable ya que asumió asumir con la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus padres , el destino del crédito es para la compra de una moto ya que esto también le servirá como herramienta de trabajo, se siente muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza puesta en el ya que es un apoyo muy grande para el.
texts.en: Deivid, 19, was born in Santa Cruz.  He’s single and lives with his parents in their house.  He lives in the community of Junta Pirai and his activity is public transportation services on the Torno-La Calera route; he has one year’s experience.  Deivid helps out his parents with household expenses with this activity.  He’s a very hardworking young man and despite his young age is very responsible since he took on the responsibility of caring for his parents.  He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle since this too will serve as a work tool.  He feels very grateful to the institution for the trust placed in him since it’s a very big support for him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastics, rubber, flasks and food containers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: For the past 9 years, Cecilia has been operating a drug store in Jukwa, near Abura, in the Central Region of Ghana. Cecilia has received junior high education. She is married and has 1 child.  She responsibly assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy medicines (drugs) to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to buy medicines (drugs) to resell.

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Aura Elena tiene 21 años, a pesar de su edad es una joven muy emprendedora. Ella se dedica a la venta de quesillos y ropa nueva, desde hace más de 5 años. Aura vende sus productos de manera ambulante en colegios, hospitales entre otros lugares en donde tiene una gran parte de clientes que saben lo buena y carismática que es. El negocio inicio por su Mama que le enseño a tener este medio de trabajo ya que además tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa para niños, pantalones, camisas, faldas, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Aura Elena, 21, despite her age is a very enterprising young woman.  She has been selling custards and new clothes for the last five years.  Aura sells her items at schools, hospitals and other places where she has most of her customers who know how good and charismatic she is.  She started the business because of her mother who taught her to have this means of support since she has a minor son in her care.  The reason for the loan is to buy clothes for children, pants, shirts and skirts, among other products.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes, pants, shirts and skirts, among others.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary owns a clothes shop, which she has run for seven years. She got the idea knowing that there are many who travel to Malindi to visit the town. She is married and has a 4-year-old child who has just started kindergarten. They live in Malindi town of the Coastal Province, Kenya. The main challenge with her business comes during the low season between February and July when there are low sales. Many tourists leave the town during the time of August through to January of the following year. 

Rosemary was invited to join Milango by her friends and has been a client of Milango Financial Services for eight months. A loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings will help her restock her stall in preparation for December festivities. She desires to restock her business from the actual manufacturers and not through middlemen – a feat she can only achieve with higher capital. Rosemary intends to open other clothes shops within Malindi town. This loan will help improve her life, save and make plans for her young child.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a driver. She has completed senior high school.

For the past 15 years, Mary has traveled around the vicinity of Jukwa to sell cosmetics. She uses her income to support her husband in educating, feeding and clothing her child. Mary will use this loan to purchase cosmetics (creams, powder and other items) to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, mattreses and pillows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of corn

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells salted fish, provisions and corn dough in Jukwa, near Abura. She has been selling corn dough (shown in the photo) for 20 years.

Comfort has received senior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a blacksmith. Comfort assists him in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy corn to make dough to sell. Comfort hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy extra bags of maize.

loans.use: to buy corn to make dough to sell.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marina del Carmen tiene 51 años, es soltera, y tiene tres hijos (dos cursando el bachillerato, y uno en escuela primaria).

Marina del Carmen se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace muchos años. Hace ocho años ella abrió un comedor, donde ella vende almuerzos todos los días. Además del comedor, Marina del Carmen también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa. Todos los días ella se levanta a las 4am a moler el maíz con el que luego prepara tortillas. Desde las 7:30am hasta las 11:00am Marina del Carmen hace tortillas. Luego, ella prepara los almuerzos hasta el medio día, y los vende en el comedor que tiene en su casa hasta las 2pm. El resto de la tarde ella se dedica a preparar lo necesario para el día siguiente. Su jornada termina aproximadamente a las 5pm.

Marina del Carmen ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de inventario para su tienda. Actualmente la tienda es pequeña y poco surtida. Sin embargo, ella se ha dado cuenta que hay mucha demanda de granos básicos. Con un mejor inventario ella podrá tener mejores ventas, y así tener mejores ganancias para su familia. El sueño de Marina del Carmen es tener la mejor tienda en su colonia, y asegurar el estudio universitario de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina del Carmen, 51, is single and has three children (two are in high school and one in elementary school).  She has been selling food for many years.  Eight years ago she opened an eatery where she sells lunches daily.  In addition to the eatery, Marina del Carmen has a small home-based grocery store.  She rises daily at 4am to grind the corn she later uses to make tortillas.  From 7:30am until 11am Marina del Carmen makes tortillas and then makes the lunches until noon.  She sells them at the eatery she has at home until 2pm.  The rest of the afternoon is dedicated to making preparations for what will be needed the next day.  Her work day ends at about 5pm.

Marina del Carmen has asked Foundation Campo for a loan to buy stock items for her store.  It’s currently small and poorly stocked.  Nevertheless, she’s noted that demand for basic grains is high.  With better inventory she will have improved sales and thus better profits for her family.  Marina del Carmen’s dream is to have the best store in her neighborhood and to insure her children’s university studies.

loans.use: to enlarge her store's stock inventory, especially basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items for his bakery.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been running a retail shop for six years – an idea she got to meet the needs of her school-going children. She also supplies fresh fruit to hotels for additional income. She is married and has three children, ages 18, 16, 10 years old. All attend school; the elder two in high schools and the last in primary school. She lives in Malindi town of the Coastal Province, Kenya. 

Josephine joined Milango in April, 2011, after an invitation from a friend. Her major challenge comes from her supply business where payments are made on a monthly basis. A loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings will help Josephine restock her business with retail stock like soap, sugar, flour, oil, etc. Josephine intends to faithfully repay her upcoming loan, so she can obtain higher credit and establish a salon and a boutique. This loan will also help her obtain additional income to carry out farming on the piece of land she bought using her first loan. She hopes Milango partners, especially KIVA, will support her with credit for her upcoming businesses.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock like sugar, flour, oil, etc

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been a food vendor for one year now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock, bought a TV set and a fridge.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase on her food stock.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Azizi", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase food stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of salt to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Dorila Magdalena

texts.es:
Dorila tiene 52 años es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en Cotacachi a 30 min de Ibarra en el norte de Ecuador. Se describe como una persona tranquila, honesta y trabajadora.

Dorila trabaja sola en su tienda de víveres. Es el primer crédito que solita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de víveres para abastecer su tienda lo cual mejorará sus ingresos.

Su sueño es poder tener su propio micromercado.
texts.en: Dorila, 52, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in Cotacachi 30 minutes from Ibarra in northern Ecuador.  She describes herself as a calm, honest, hardworking person.  She works alone in her grocery store.  This is her first loan request to Fodemi and she will use it to buy merchandise to stock her store which will improve her income.  Her dream is to own her a minimarket.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gregorio Eliut

texts.es:
Gregorio, vive junto con su esposa y una hija, él tiene una tienda de productos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz) inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia, hace tres años, todos los días trabaja, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para crecer más su tienda y comprar más mercadería como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite y detergentes,de esa forma su negocio estara fortalecido.
El sueño de Gregorio es, incrementar  sus ventas y  tendrá más variedad y cubrir sus obligaciones y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio lives with his wife and daughter. He has a commodities store selling rice, beans, sugar, corn. He started the business on his own inititative 3 years ago. He works every day and does not have a fixed schedule.

He will use the loan to his expand store and buy more goods such as: sugar, rice, beans, oil and detergents. In this way his business will be strengthened.

Gregorio's dream is to increase sales and have more variety as well as meeting with his obligations and getting ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil and detergents for the business.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu is a fish monger. She sells provisions as well. The small mini-shop behind her is stocked with provisions such as Milo, milk, biscuits, canned fish and tomatoes and other things. She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a security man. Zenabu has been selling provisions for 5 years.

The loan, when received, will be used to acquire other types of provisions to bring variety into the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: to acquire other types of provisions to bring variety into the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm fruits to process into oil for sale

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
La señora Clara Luz tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y tres hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica desde hace doce años a sembrar maíz, esta actividad la aprendió de su padrastro. Clara Luz debe adquirir los insumos necesarios para que su cultivo pueda desarrollarse, por lo que debe trasladarse a la ciudad en busca de ellos el recorrido tarda unas dos horas de ida y vuelta a la casa en autobús.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para la compra de insumos agrícolas, para el cultivo de maíz y darle seguimiento al desarrollo del cultivo de ajonjolí que ya tiene sembrado. Con el préstamo ella pretende comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez para conseguir precios más bajos y estará segura de dar sus cultivos un manejo a tiempo, de esta forma tendrá una mejor producción.

Al incrementar la producción, ella tendrá más ingresos, por lo que estaría asegurando la alimentación de su familia y el pago a tiempo de su préstamo. Clara Luz ahorrara de las ganancias que reciba de la venta de su cultivos y comprar tres vacas lecheras, para tener otra fuente de  ingresos y enviar a sus hijos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Clara Luz, 49, lives with her life companion and three children.  She’s a very hardworking woman.  She’s been farming corn for the last 12 years.  She learned this activity from her step-father.  Clara Luz must acquire the necessary supplies so that her crops can develop and must travel to the city in search of them, a round trip from home that takes about two hours by bus.

She’s asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy farming supplies for her corn crops and to follow up on the development of her sesame crops that she’s already planted.  With the loan she intends to buy all the supplies at one time so that she can get lower prices and be sure to provide proper care to her plants on time so that production will be better.

Increasing production will lead to more income which will allow her to insure her family’s food needs and the timely repayment of her loan.  Clara Luz will save some of the profits she earns from the sale of her crops to buy three dairy cows to have an additional source of income and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi has been making local soap in Elmina for 10 years. This soap is popularly called “Asumah Blows”, perhaps because it is very hard and lasts long. Asumah Nelson is a popular retired Ghanaian boxer. He was a great fighter and his punch could make an opponent weak.

Esi is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a mason. Esi supports her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to make soap to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure more palm fruits to make oil.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora es cliente de Fundación por vario tiempo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, que atiende desde hace 5 años. Empieza su labor desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar los diferentes productos que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, papel higiénicos, cigarrillos, golosinas, pan, gaseosas y refrescos. María sueña con seguir creciendo con su negocio y agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for some time. She has been managing a store for five years. María begins her work at 7am and continues until 10pm. Most of her customers come in search of the different products she offers.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, soups, toilet paper, cigarettes, candy, bread, sodas, and soft drinks. María dreams of continuing to grow her business and expand her inventory.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to make soap

loans.use: to buy an industrial kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale.
